Samuel is a young entrepreneur who, at 20 years old, already runs his own business, which he started with the intention of collaborating with his parents in the household finances.  From a very young age Samuel accompanied his father in the farming activities, and at one point he decided to set up his own business and begin to generate resources on his own.

This is how he began with the business raising and selling pigs, which has allowed him to have a better quality of life for his family.  With this business he has been able to improve his parents' quality of life as well as to enjoy greater economic opportunities.  This is why Samuel wants to make his business keep growing, to further support his parents.

For this reason Samuel is looking for a loan that will give him the opportunity to buy livestock to raise to diversify his animal sales and increase his sales.

Samuel estimates that with a variety of animals to sell he will have better sales and, consequently, a better quality of life.  He also dreams about giving his parents much more stable finances, which will allow them to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise to diversify his animal sales and increase his sales.

loans.name: Nihaya

texts.en:
Nihaya is a conservative woman, for that reason she has asked her younger brother Ahmad to appear in the photo instead. 

Nihaya is a 29-year-old housewife. She has three daughters and a son. Her husband works for the Civil Defense Department. 

For the last three years, Nihaya was working at home, tailoring clothes and fabric to design special pieces of clothing as requested by her customers. She started this business in order to help improve her family's living conditions and help her husband support the family. 

She has applied today for a loan to buy more fabric and thread for the continuity of her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Urunana C 20011 Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old and is married with three children. She sells various goods such as cosmetics, sugar and bread. Beatrice is a leader of this group, which is called "URUNANA C20011" in the local language.  In the photo, she's the one raising her hand. This is her second year in this business and she works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. each week. Beatrice currently employs one person to help her.

Beatrice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cosmetics, sugar and bread to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cosmetics, sugar and bread to sell.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 24-year-old married man; he has a baby daughter. 

Rami owns a car parts shop, most of the parts he has are for Japanese cars. It has been a year since he started, because of his honesty in selling these parts he has gained a good number of customers. 

Now Rami wants to expand his shop and add more car parts to the store, he also wants to import and buy new car engines to add them to his shop. For that he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to import and buy new car engines

loans.name: C 20008 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Josee is 29 years old and is married with three children between 1 and 6 years old. She sells rice. Josee is a leader of this group which is called "ABISHYIZEHAMWE C20008" in the local language.  In the photo, she's the one who is sitting down. This is her 10th year in this business and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. every day except on the weekend. Josee currently employs six people to help her. 

Josee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 44 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos menores a los que cuida en casa de su mamá ubicada en Cullpa Alta. 
Sus hijos aún son pequeños, por eso tiene que incrementar sus fuerzas al doble para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Mientras que su esposo se dedica al noble oficio de albañil, ella comienza el día con la preparación de exquisita comida de casa y los fines de semana preparan comida típica y caldos para sus comensales. Ya tiene 15 años dedicándose a esto, por eso todos la conocen y aprecian mucho, además de ser la única que brinda ese servicio. Pero como es una señora trabajadora, dedicó sus tiempo libres en la venta de ropa variada a los pobladores de su localidad, quienes se siente agradecida con ella, pues deja al crédito algunas prendas, para pagar después. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias para poder poner una tienda de venta de ropa, estable y así no tener que vender como ambulante de casa en casa.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Nancy de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para preparar sus alimentos y en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 44 year old, hardworking woman. She lives with Luis, her husband of 30 years. Together they have 5 children, all minors whom Nancy cares for in their home in Cullpa Alta.

Because her children are all small, she has to invest a lot of effort in order to move her children ahead. While her husband earns a living in the noble vocation of bricklayer, she begins each day preparing exquisite homemade food to sell. On the weekends she prepares local specialties and soups for the guests who come to eat. Because Nancy has been doing this work for 10 years now, the local people know and appreciate her very much. What's more, Nancy is the only person in the area who provides this service. Since she is such a hardworking woman, she spends her free time selling a variety of clothing to the people in her area, who feel grateful toward her, since she allows them to buy some items on credit, with payment later. Now she would like to increase her earnings in order to open a clothing store, a stable place of business. By doing so, she would no longer need to sell the clothing walking house to house.  

Nancy belongs to the supportive group "Manos Fuertes" and this is her fifteenth loan with Kiva's partner, MFP. At MFP she feels herself being developed, since she receives help with which she can progress in her business. In return for the help she receives, Nancy promises to be punctual in making her payments. Additionally, she likes working with the association because the people are responsible and supportive. 

When she receives the loan, Nancy will invest the funds in the purchase of necessary ingredients with which to prepare her food, and in the purchase of clothing to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy common and necessary ingredients for her food business as well as to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband S'ood appears in her Kiva profile photo inside the house.

Sahar is a 35-year-old woman, she is married and a mother with three sons and one daughter, her husband is employed with a low salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs.

Sahar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new living room seats and dining room furniture to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Sahar and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in the house.

loans.use: To purchase living room seats and dining room furniture.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 34-year-old married lady. She has three daughters and her husband is a plumber. 

Laila has been tailoring and sewing at home for three years now, mostly for neighbors and relatives. Now that the word has spread about what she does a lot of her customer's friends have started to bring her what they want to sew or tailor. For that reason Laila has found that her current sewing machine needs some maintenance to make her job faster, so she has applied for this loan to do so and to buy a newer one to be able to serve her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a newer sewing machine

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 25 years old and a very hardworking woman. She is a manicurist and pedicurist in the village. She offers her service for 25 pesos, which is less expensive than others. With her friendly attitude, customers are looking for her. 

Robelyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase cuticle remover, nail polish, and nipper for the better service. She hopes to earn a higher amount of income with her loan and industriousness.

loans.use: to purchase cuticle remover, nail polish, and nipper.

loans.name: 08.01.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khâm is 63 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of the 08.01.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Khâm has operated a business selling clothes for over 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing for resale.

In 2010, Mrs. Khâm joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Mrs. Khâm faces in her business is a lack of capital. In the future she hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and, with her business profits, to travel on vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bris

texts.es: Bris, de 24 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Jerly y Juan a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en Cullpa Alta. Desde niña le enseñaron a burilar mates, su familia entera se dedica a ello. Por ello lleva en la sangre el arte por los buriles (dibujo sobre piezas),  ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello. Desde entonces se sintió muy feliz por ello, ya que es su pasión. Cuenta que le pagan 20 soles por buril, a la semana realiza 300 burilados, los cuales vende a una señora conocida de su localidad. Pero como a ella no le gusta desperdiciar su tiempo, se dedica también a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 5, los cuales vende después de engordarlos al mercado de carne, pero como tiene poco tiempo dedicándose a esto, le comentaron que obtendría más ganancias si los vende como lechón (comida típica), por ello comenzará con la crianza intensiva y de esa manera pueda preparar por ella misma el exquisito lechón. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Bris de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para hacer la casa a sus cerdos y también un espacio para que puedan alimentarse.
texts.en:
Bris, 24, is an unassuming woman.  She lives with her two children, Jerly and Juan who she cares for in her own house located in Cullpa Alta.  Since she was a little girl she was taught the art of “mate burilado” [carved gourds]; her entire family does this.  This is why she carries this art in her blood.  She’s been doing it now for ten years.  She’s always been very happy with it because she’s passionate about it.  She relates that she’s paid 20 soles per gourd and she makes 300 per week which she sells to a well-known woman in her location.

However, since she does not like to waste time, she also raises pigs.  She has five of them which once they are fattened up she sells to the meat market but since she’s only been doing this for a short period of time she was told that she’d make more profits if she sold them as “lechón” [traditional food] so she is going to start to raise them intensively so she herself can prepare the delicious lechón.

She belongs to the “Manos Fuertes” (Strong Hands) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan.  She feels empowered because she gets the help to make progress in her business.  Because of this she promises to be punctual with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys working with her communal bank because they are responsible, supportive people.  

If Bris were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy supplies to build enclosures for her pigs and also space where they can feed.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her pig stables.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha is a 21-year-old housewife. She wanted to start a small business from her house – a basic beauty salon. She bought a little equipment such as a hair dryer, hair clips and others as a start. She has applied for this loan to buy cosmetic products and makeup.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and makeup.

loans.name: Marjorette

texts.en:
Marjorette lives in Baliuag with her spouse and two school-aged children. She is 21 years old. She was engaged in an early marriage and did not finish her educaton. To help her spouse generate income for the family, she established a business selling grocery items to the people in her village. She has been doing this for almost two years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks to sell in her store. Someday, she will be happy to attain her goal of improving her sales and bettering her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn runs a retail store. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She has been in this business for two years now. Jocelyn is married to a farmer named Jose and together they raise two children. 

She is borrowing a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy sardines, noodles, shampoo and soaps to sell in her store. These additional items will increase her sales. In the future, Jocelyn would like to keep improving the sales from her business so she can earn enough to fund the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, shampoo and soaps to sell in her store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 44, is a fruits and vegetables vendor who travels daily to various municipalities to sell to households and loyal customers. With her good quality products, she has many customers and for this reason is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy camote tops, banana, beans and ginger as additional goods to sell. Marilyn hopes to earn a good income from this expansion and be able to save funds for her dream store.

loans.use: to buy camote tops, bananas, beans and ginger.

loans.name: Monadel

texts.en:
Monadel is a 42 year old man. He is married with two sons. He is a Dentist and before one year ago he opened a Dental Clinic, which has been a profitable project.

Monadel is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of making decorations to the Dental Clinic such as: installing lights and painting, also purchasing furniture, such as chairs and tables, for the reception hall. This will improve the Clinic's condition better and offer customers a comfortable and healthy place to wait.
Monadel is photographed in his Dental Clinic.

loans.use: To change the decorations and purchase furniture for his Dental Clinic.

loans.name: 08.01.02 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghị is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of the 08.01.02 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Nghị has run a business selling clothes for over 10 years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to resell.

In 2010, Mrs. Nghị joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has already successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital. Mrs. Nghị hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Janeath

texts.en: Jeneath, 30 years old and married, has been selling fruits and vegetables such as bananas and pechay for more than one year, an activity that has  improved her family's living situation. Jeneath is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy pineapples, eggplant, carrots and cabbage. She hopes to continue to improve their standard of living through this loan and her hard work.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, eggplant, carrots and cabbage.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilmer de 27 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Ros, su esposa. Juntos cuidan a su hija Ximena en su casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Palian. Él es albañil, todos los días trabaja con mucho ahínco para poder sacar a su familia adelante. Vive en una casa alquilada, por el momento, pues ya está juntando dinero para comprarse uno propio. Según cuenta gana muy bien en su trabajo, pues a diferencia de otros de su oficio él trabaja con un arquitecto, quien diseña la casa integra para luego ser construida por él y otros albañiles más. De esa manera cobran más dinero. Lo que más le gusta es viajar, ahora tiene un proyecto e la costa donde estará unos meses trabajando. Por su parte sus esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales en la localidad de Los Libertadores de Huari, donde cría alpacas y vicuñas. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos, pues todavía su hija no estudia y quiere aprovechar ese tiempo para ahorrar lo que pueda, con el fin de comprar su casa propia. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente contento de recibir el apoyo económico para progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias.
Wilder de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madera para comenzar a construir la casa en donde lo contrataron.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 27, is a hardworking man.  He lives with his wife, Ros, and together they care for their daughter, Ximena, in a rented house located in Palian.  He’s a bricklayer.  He works very hard every day to move his family ahead.  For the moment, he’s living in a rented house but he’s already saving money to buy a house of his own.  According to him, he earns well in his job because unlike others in his profession he works with an architect who design the entire house which is then built by him and other bricklayers.  This way they can charge more money.  What he enjoys the most is to travel and he currently has a project that will take him to work at the coast for a few months.  On her part, his wife raises animals in Los Libertadores de Huari; she raises alpacas and vicuñas.  He wants to improve his income because his daughter does not attend school yet and he wants to take advantage of this time to save up as much as possible in order to buy his own house.

This is the second MFP loan and he feels happy to get financial support to progress with his business.  He promises to be punctual with his installment payments because his association is made up of responsible, supportive people.

If Wilmer were to receive your support he will use the money to buy lumber to start building the house he’s been contracted to build.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house.

loans.name: Veberlyn

texts.en: Veberlyn is 37 years old and married. She is blessed with two children. Veberlyn is engaged in selling pigs she raises and fattens up. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy feed, vitamins and two more pigs to fatten. In the future, she hopes that her children finish their studies and are able to help her in lifting their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and two more pigs to fatten

loans.name: 08.01.01 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Phượng is 60 years old and married with 3 children. She is the leader of the 08.01.01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Phượng lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a business selling clothes for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to resell.

In 2010, Phượng joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital. Phượng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to one day remodel her house using her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Abella

texts.en:
Abella is a a rice farmer living in General Balao. He involved himself in this kind of business to earn a living. He plants and harvests rice to sell to local traders in their villages. He usually earn about 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season, which usually occur twice per year.
 
Abella is 45 years old and married with one child. 

He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. He also would like to improve his farming practices for the improvement of his business and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Mayo Jane

texts.en: Mayo Jane  is 20 years old, married and has one child. She sells vegetables such as green leafy vegetables, root crops and beans. She is patiently selling every morning to earn and save money for her only child. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy camote, bananas, bitter melons and  cabbage to sell. In the future, Mayo Jane would like, through her loan, to have better sales from her business in order to provide a bright future for her child.

loans.use: to buy camote, bananas, bitter melons and  cabbage

loans.name: Teva

texts.es: Teva, de 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Concepción. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de leche que extrae de sus vacas que están en su establo, enseñó a sus 3 hijos que también le apoyan en ordeñar la leche de sus vacas por las mañanas para luego venderlas a una compañía de productos lácteos que le permite tener ingresos diarios. Considera que  es muy rentable la venta de leche porque  diariamente se percibe el dinero y la inversión  no es muy costosa ya que dispone de alimento suficiente para sus vacas, pues ella misma siembra alfalfa, que extrae de sus terrenos de cultivo. Para más adelante desea tener más vacas en su establo y otros animales más, pues quiere incursionar en la venta de animales ovinos y porcinos, sabe que lo conseguirá, pues ella es una mujer dedicada y empeñosa. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Teva de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Teva, 47, lives with her husband and three children in her own house located in Concepción.  She’s dedicated her entire life to selling milk she gets from the cows in her stable.  She taught her three children to help her milk the cows in the morning to then sell the milk to a firm that makes dairy products which makes it possible for her to earn daily income.  She considers milk sales to be very profitable because she earns money and the investment isn’t too costly because she has sufficient feed for her cows since she grows alfalfa herself in her own fields.  For later on she’d like to have more cows in her stable as well as other animals because she wants to go into sheep and pig sales.  She knows she’ll accomplish this because she’s very dedicated and focused.

This is the third MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she will have financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all its members are people she knows and they are responsible and very mutually supportive.  She thanks those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress.  If Teva were to get your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of sheep to increase her herd of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel, de 40 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Mariela, su esposa y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ocopilla. Gracias a su esfuerzo, logró construir un negocio estable. Su esposa se dedica al cuidado de la tienda de ropa que abrieron en una zona céntrica de la ciudad hace 8 años, le va muy bien tanto así que ahora, espera ampliar y remodelar su negocio. Mientras que él trabaja como taxista con su propio auto, todos los días durante la mañana, pues en las noches descansa junto a su familia. Su principal meta es construir su casa propia, bien equipada. Quiere construir 3 pisos, va por los dos pisos y muy pronto piensa en construir el tercero, “me falta poco”, menciona. Como es un hombre de proyectos, piensa en ahorrar para pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, quienes muy pronto concluirán el colegio. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente contento de recibir el apoyo económico para progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias.Ángel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el arreglo mecánico de su auto, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará muebles para su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel, 40, is a hardworking man living with his wife, Mariela, and their three children they care for in his own house located in Ocopilla.  Thanks to his efforts, he managed to build a stable business.  His wife runs a clothing store they opened 8 years ago in a centrally-located spot in the city; she does very well so much so that she’s now planning to expand and remodel the store.

He works as a taxi driver with his own car every day during the morning since he rests with his family in the evening.  His main goal is to build his own, well equipped house.   He wants to build three floors; he’s currently on the second one and very soon plans to start the third.  “I’m getting close,” he mentions.  Since he’s a man of many projects, he plans to save up to pay for his children’s university studies; they will be finishing high school pretty soon.

This is the third MFP loan.  He feels good about receiving financial support to make progress in his business.  In addition, he promises to be punctual with his installment payments because his association is composed of responsible, mutually supportive people.  

If Ángel were to receive your support, he will invest the requested funds in servicing his car and if money is left over will buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: to pay to service his vehicle and to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 54 years old and has five children. She has been raising and breeding hogs for almost two years now. She involved herself in raising hogs to add to her spouse's income from a farming business. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy medicines and vitamins for her hogs. In the future, Florinda would like to ensure that her hogs grow strong and enable her to earn more income when she sells them.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan is 37 years old and married with one child. Her son is 9 years old and studies in a local school. She herself is a very talented lady. She sews & embroiders on clothes and earns income for her family. Her income allows her to manage the household expenses. 

Her husband is a talented man himself. He works making wooden cots. He offers his services to community clients and also to the market people. This is his family business which was started by his forefathers.  

He is very honest in dealing with his clients and his quality in work attracts them towards him.  

Hamidan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying wood and nails for making the cots in larger quantity and increasing his income.
 
Hamidan is very confident about the future growth of her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy wood and nails for a wooden cots making & selling business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Managing a sari-sari (variety) store from 6:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. makes Gemma busy in her everyday routine. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She has been doing this for five years. She is very thankful for her customers who buy merchandise from her store and provide a daily allowance for her youngest child. She has three children. Two of them have settled into marriage. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy sugar, coffee, breads, eggs, and soap to sell in her store. Additional merchandise will help her acquire more profits and improve her sales, too.

Gemma still aims to extend friendly service to her customers and have a stable business, too.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, breads, eggs, and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is selling food products such as sweetened malagkit (sticky rice), kutsinta (a sweet made from rice, brown sugar and coconut) and rice cakes. She sells every morning and at snack time in the afternoon. Most of her customers are children who like sweet foods. The food products she sells are also in demand by the teachers in the village, so she always goes to the elementary school to sell. 

Florencia is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy malagkit, flour, milk and sugar. These products would provide her delicious goods. Through them, she could acquire more customers. Hopefully, with this simple business of hers, she can also improve her family’s living situation.

loans.use: to buy malagkit (sticky rice), flour, milk and sugar

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She is married to Ciriaco, a farmer. To add to her spouse’s income from the farming business, Gina raises hogs to fatten and breed and sells them to butchers upon maturity. Though she only acquires a minimal income from her business, she is very happy to add to her spouse’s income in covering other needs of the family. Together, they work hard for the family's welfare.
 
She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

Someday, with stable businesses, the family will achieve better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is 47 years old, married with 7 children who are between 11 and 25 years of age. Besides her eldest son and eldest daughter, the others are getting their education. Her eldest son is a driver by profession and her daughter does sewing. Both are financially contributing to the family.  
Azra herself is a very caring and supportive lady. She is involved in the embroidery profession. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which earns good profit for her.  
Her husband is a driver by profession. He drives a three-wheeled vehicle called a rickshaw and offers his services. He drops his passengers to their designated places. He has set charges route-wise which are very affordable for passengers.  
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will change the body of his rickshaw and give it a presentable look so the passengers prefer getting his services and feel safe. 
She is hopeful that the loan will be proved a productive one for her husband.

loans.use: To change the body of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Aduriana

texts.en:
Aduriana is raising hogs for a living. She is widowed and has four children. Two have finished their education, while the rest are in their college level. Her eldest daughter works abroad to help with other needs of the family.

Aduriana decided to avail a loan in order to improve her hog raising business. She is asking for PHP 6,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs. She wanted to ensure good nutrition of her hogs to offer them at higher cost upon distribution. 

She will be thankful enough if this loan will be granted to her and promises to pay it back in full.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Rehana Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rehana bibi is 42 years old and married with four children. All of her family is involved in a thread rolls selling business. They help each other in making thread rolls, so Rehana’s husband goes to market to visit different thread sellers for buying. Rehana and her husband have been involved in this business for over 20 years. Now they feel good that their family has increased not only their manpower but also produced good results. Now they easily fulfill the larger orders on time and have built an excellent image for their clients. 

Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of their family business. They will invest the loan in buying thread in larger quantity for reselling. They are very confident about the positive financial outcomes from the investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehana bibi”.

loans.use: To buy thread for her thread rolls selling business.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 43 years old, married and has three children. Only one child is attending school so Hilaria still needs to provide for the one child's daily allowance and school expenses. She cooks and sells snacks like bananas and camote que (deep fried banana and sweet potato coated in caramelized brown sugar). She is patiently doing this to earn money. She is now asking for additional capital of P5,000 to buy sugar, bananas and camote to cook and sell.
In the future, Hilaria would like to keep making better sales from her business and continuously finance the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bananas and camote to cook and sell.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky, age 26, is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She would like to increase her sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy eggplants, bananas, ginger and onions as additional goods to sell. She hopes to gain more income  because of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, bananas, ginger and onions as additional goods to sell

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA  est la représentante du groupe BASNEWENDE. Elle est mariée  et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Les 02  vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des légumes (choux, tomate)  depuis14ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Boussé, Péla et Yako  au BURKINA. Ses clients sont  les  femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02 sacs de choux et 02 caisses de tomate et d’autres condiments.

 Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  épargner pour s’acheter une moto afin de faciliter ses déplacements et d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the Basnewende group. She is married and mother to three children. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest 4. Two of them go to school. She has three dependents.

She has been selling vegetables (cabbages and tomatoes) for the past 14 years and gets her supplies in Boussé, Péla and Yako in Burkina. Her customers are women.

She would like to buy two sacks of cabbages and two crates of tomatoes and other condiments. 

She uses her profits to improve her family's living conditions. Her ambition is to save up to buy a motorbike to make moving around easier, and also to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of cabbages and two crates of tomatoes plus other condiments.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 41 años es una mujer comprometida con el progreso. Vive en compañía de Fredolino su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los cuales cría en casa de su suegra, ubicado en la localidad de Huari. Como todas las mañanas, los padres de familia al dejar a sus hijos al colegio pasan por la pequeña carpa de la señora Luzmila, quien hace 11 años vende dulces y juguetes a los niños de la escuela del barrio. Se siente muy dichosa de estar ahí todos la conocen y hasta miró crecer a varios niños quienes ahora le dicen “tía”, pues ella se siente como tal, ya que los miró crecer y desarrollarse. Eso es el secreto que tiene para mantener su negocio hasta la actualidad, donde obtiene muy buenas ganancias que le permite ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Pues su esposo es cerrajero de profesión y ya muchos lo conocen, por ser quien les ayuda en casa con los problemas de las llaves y demás. Sus planes son adquirir un local cómodo y amplio para no solo vender dulces si no comida y demás alimentos para la lonchera de los niños que tanto quiere. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Jatary Ayllu” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde fue invitada a progresar como las demás socias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta su asociación, ya que son personas responsables y solidarias. Luzmila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería como dulces y juguetes variados.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 41, is a woman who is committed to progress.  She lives with Fredolino, her husband of 20 years.  They have three children they raise in her mother-in-law’s house located in Huari.

Like every morning, parents pass by Luzmila’s tent on their way to drop off their children at school; she’s been selling candy and toys to the school children in the neighborhood for 11 years.  She feels very fortunate to be there; everybody knows her and she’s watched many of the children grow up who today call her “tía” (auntie) because she feels as if she were since she’s watched so many of them grow and develop.  That’s the secret she has to stay in business so far; she earns good profits that help her contribute to household expenses.  Since her husband’s a locksmith by profession many know him because he’s the one that helps them with problems with keys and other things at their homes.  Her plan is to acquire a comfortable, spacious locale to sell not only candy but also food and other lunch box items for the children she loves so much.

She belongs to the “Jatary Ayllu” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan she was invited to be part of by the rest of the members which is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments because she likes the association since they are responsible and mutually supportive people.

If Luzmila were to get your support, she will use the requested money to buy merchandise like candy and assorted toys.

loans.use: to buy candy and an assortment of toys.

loans.name: 08.01.11 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of the 08.01.11 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Hồng lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Hồng has run a manufacturing business making wood furniture for over 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood for woodworking.

In 2010, Hồng joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties she faces is a lack of capital. Hồng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well and, with her business profits, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for woodworking.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 61 years old and has five children. She is married to a farmer. Visitacion is raising hogs to sell when they reach maturity. She has been in this business for almost four years and earns PHP 3,000 for each hog she sells. 

She is now borrowing a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy hog medicines, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Someday, she hopes to construct a more convenient pen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy hog medicines, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hens to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking mother. Aside from helping her husband in the farming business, she also raises hogs to sell in times of needs. She has been raising hogs for about three years. She earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per hog. 

She would like to maintain her hog raising business; that is why she decided to borrow additional capital to make improvements on it. She is borrowing an amount of 30,000 PHP to buy an additional piglet to raise, along with food and vitamins for its sustainability. 

Mercedita has three children attending to school and in need of daily allowances. Educating her children up to college will be a great achievement for her and the best best legacy she can pass on to them.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet to raise, along with food and vitamins for its sustainability.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and married. She has one kid who is going in school. Imelda runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in their village. She sells drinks, spices, breads and canned goods. Her goal in life is to continue to send her child to school so they will have a better future.

Imelda could not satisfy her customer’s wants because she had only minimal grocery items to sell. She wanted to increase the kinds of products to sell in their village, but she did not have enough capital to do it. In this connection, Imelda wishes for a loan of P50,000 to buy additional grocery items like eggs, noodles, shampoo and soap. 

She hopes to make her store full of groceries to sell that will satisfy her customers needs. Through income she will earn from her business, she will provide her child's basic needs in school and their daily food.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items like eggs, noodles, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Ameena Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ameena bibi is 37 years old and married with five children. Her husband and first two sons are involved in a crushed woods selling business. They handle a good clientele base. Different people use the crushed woods for different purposes. Some use it for burning, while some use it in furniture making. In this way, they earn good profits from their sales.
 
Ameena bibi herself is a caring & supportive lady by nature. She finishes her household responsibilities on time and also does sewing work part time. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from this Kiva partner for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in the buying of crushed woods for reselling. Ameena is hopeful about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy crushed woods for reselling.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna lives at Solana with her husband and three children. She has been raising hogs to earn an income for the schooling of her youngest child. Her spouse is a farmer. 

Lorna is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy an additional piglet to raise and also feed for its maintenance. She is hoping to ensure proper growth and nutrition for her hogs so that upon distribution, she will offer them at higher cost and earn good profits in it. 

Someday, this will help improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet to raise and also feed for its maintenance.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 33 años, convive con Tito con quien tiene 4 hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 9 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Tarma. Olga es una mujer responsable y cariñosa. Con esa actitud realiza sus labores obteniendo satisfactorios resultados. Ella se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra de hortalizas como zanahorias, arvejas, espinacas y flores de  “Saritas” (flores blancas pequeñas).
“Es rentable sembrar estos productos, pero lo que me conviene más es el cultivo de “saritas”, por que no necesita mucha inversión”, comenta.
De las 3 parcelas de terrenos que cuenta genera alrededor de 5000 soles, pero de ahí tiene que descontar toda la inversión en la compra de abonos, semillas y pago de personal.
Al inició su producción era mínima, pero conforme pasaron los años fue aumentando gracias al trabajo coordinado con MFP. De esa manera puede darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida con el pasar de los años. Ahora tiene pensado trabajar para comprase un automóvil para trasladar con facilidad sus productos. Éste sería su crédito número 11 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sarita Colonia”, afirma que es un grupo solidario y responsable.
Con el dinero que piensa obtener comprará 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas; con lo restante adquirirá sacos de fertilizantes orgánicos para garantizar el crecimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Olga, 33, lives with Tito, with whom she has four children, ages 15, 13, 11, and 9.  They all live in their own house in the district of Tarma.  Olga is a responsible and affectionate woman.  She does her work with this attitude and gets satisfactory results.  She works in agriculture growing vegetables such as carrots, peas, spinach, and "sarita" flowers (small white flowers).

"It is profitable to plant these products, but what is more convenient is growing 'saritas' because they do not need a lot of investment," she comments.  From the three parcels of land she has, she generates about 5000 soles (PEN), but after that she has to deduct all the investment in buying fertilizer, seeds, and pay for personnel.

In the beginning her output was minimal, but as the years passed it increased thanks to the work coordinated with MFP.  In this way she can giver her family a better quality of life as the years go by.  Now she is thinking about buying herself a car to move her products more easily.

This will be her eleventh loan with MFP, so she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  She belongs to the Sarita Colonia communal bank.  She asserts that it is a supportive and responsible group.

With the money she plans to get she will buy three bags of pea seed; with the rest she will acquire sacks of organic fertilizer to guarantee the growth of her crops.

loans.use: to buy three bags of pea seed and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is a 43 year old woman who has many aspirations in life. And the major goal is to uplift her family from poor living. With this matter, she is engaged in selling fish in the village. She works alone everyday because the eagerness to earn is in her. 

Right now, she is asking for a loan of P13,000 as additional working capital to purchase fish, vegetables and snacks as additional goods to offer. She is hoping for improvement of her income through her loan so that she can use proceeds for the educational purposes of her four children.

loans.use: to purchase fish, vegetables and snacks as additional goods to offer.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Due to financial burden, Allan aimed to improve his rice farming business to satisfy his family's needs and gives them a better life. He has three school age children and wants them to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. Despite the hardships in farming, he believes that he will be able to support his family. 

He planned to expand his rice plantation to insure high yields, but due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming. He believes that the loan will enable him to make improvements in his farming business and he is hoping that he will be having a high production this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming.

loans.name: 08.01.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Oanh is 50 years old and married with 2 children. Oanh is the leader of the 08.01.05 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Oanh has run a business selling porcelain products (such as bowls, plates and cups) for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more porcelain products to resell.

In 2010, Oanh joined Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is a lack of capital. She hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more porcelain products (bowls, plates, cups) to resell.

loans.name: Kareem's Group

texts.en:
Kareem is 54 years old and married with two children who are 21 and 17 years old. Both of her sons are masons and contribute to the family financially. 

Kareem herself is a very cooperative lady. She weaves carpets and rugs, which is considered a very demanding task among people. She works very hard to fulfill orders and earns good money after completing them on time. Her income allows her to manage the household expenses. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He drives a rickshaw in different areas and provides his services to the passengers. He has set his charges route-wise which are very affordable for his passengers. 

Kareem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. He will invest the loan in repairing his rickshaw because it is creating problems for him while driving. 

Kareem is hopeful that the fully repaired rickshaw will enable her husband to provide his services to many more passengers, and that he will be able to drive it for longer hours. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kareem”.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar is a widow and lives with her seven children. Her eldest son works in a vegetable market, while her eldest daughter works with her mother in her beauty salon business. Her other three daughters are involved in the sewing profession. As for her last two sons: one son is studying in 10th standard and the youngest one is free and doesn’t do anything. 

Naseem is involved in the beauty salon business. She operates her business at her home. She recently started her business two years ago. She is now running it with her eldest daughter’s support. Her daughter helps her in taking care of the customers and fulfills their work.   

After the death of her husband, Naseem and her family worked really hard to live a sustainable life. Naseem herself feels blissful to have a very supportive family.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her beauty salon business. She will invest the loan in buying beauty products and makeup items for the further growth of her beauty salon’s business.  

She is hopeful that her salon will become a renowned salon and her clients will become her regular clients.  

Note: In the photo, one of her group’s members has a clothes sales business. That’s why they are holding clothes.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and makeup items for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 13 years old, and she takes care of 8 relatives. She sells clothes for children and shoes for women. She has been in this business for ten years and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Emerthe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes for children and shoes for women to resell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for children and shoes for women to resell.

loans.name: C13518 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Claudine 38 years old and is married with three children between the ages of three and ten years old. Her business is well-organized. Claudine works from 6 am until 10 pm every day and has four years of experience. 

Claudine is requesting a loan from the Kiva lender, Vision Finance Company, to expand her business by buying more quantities of Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, vegetables, beans, and other items to sell. With her profits, she will pay her children's school fees and renovate her own house.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, vegetables, beans, and other items to sell

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton, de 23 años es hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Carmencita y sus hermanos: Blady y Rosa, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Huari. A pesar de las críticas que tienen los chicos por ejercer este oficio en el país. Él no se amilana, al contrario se mantiene fuerte y feliz, pues es lo que más le gusta y le hace feliz, la peluquería es u pasión. Hace 2 años apertura una tienda de servicios junto a su hermana, donde abre las puertas todos los días a la espera de clientes que deseen verse bellas. Los servicios que ofrecen son variados, y van entre teñidos, cortes, ondulaciones, peinados, maquillaje, lavado, manicure y demás, Confiesa que lo que más le gusta es que sus clientes estén contentos. Por ello los fines de semana son los días donde tiene más clientela, ya que ahí obtiene más ingresos.  Ahora desea remodelar su peluquería, sabe que es muy difícil sobre todo costoso, pero no se da por vencido y comenzará poco  a poco hasta lograr su objetivo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Jatary Ayllu” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde fue invitado a progresar como las demás socias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta su asociación, ya que son personas responsables y solidarias. Nilton de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de sillas de buena calidad para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nilton, 23, is a responsible man.  He lives with his mother, Carmencita, and his siblings, Blady and Rosa, in a rented house in Huari.  Despite criticism boys receive in this country for being in this profession he does not become discouraged, on the contrary, he stays strong and happy because what he likes best and what makes him happy and what is his passion is his beauty salon.  

Two years ago he and his sister opened a beauty salon where they open their doors every day waiting for clients that want to look beautiful.  The services they offer are varied.  They include hair color, cuts, waving, styling, make-up, washing, manicure and others.  He confesses that what he likes best is to see his customers be happy.  Weekends are the busiest days and that’s when he earns the most.  He’d like to remodel his salon and knows it will be difficult and costly but he does not give up and will begin to little by little reach his goal.

He belongs to the “Jatary Ayllu” communal bank and this is his first loan with MFP where he was invited to join to make progress like the other members.  Because of this he promises to be punctual with his installment payments because he likes his association since they are responsible, mutually supportive people.

If Nilton were to get your support, he will invest the requested money in good quality salon chairs for his business.

loans.use: to buy barber chairs.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a hard working father who owns and manages a rice farming business to support his family. He is 42 years old and has four school-age children. He and his wife agreed to educate their children so that they can earn a degree and become professionals someday. Despite their hardships, they have the determination to work out their plans. 

Armando has been a farmer for more than 15 years earning profits of PHP 25,000 every harvest season. He wants to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production, but due to insufficient capital he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay for labor costs. Through his patience and hard work, he believes that he can increase his yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor costs for his rice plantation

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 26 years old and married with two children. She has sold fruits and vegetables in the village for more than four months. This is her way in helping her husband as well as improving their living situation. To earn higher income, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 as additional working capital. This will be used to purchase banana, cabbage, pechay and beans in addition to her offered products.

Hopefully, she will lift up their poor lifestyle as other people are aiming for. She prays for the growth of her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase banana, cabbage, pechay and beans

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando lives in General Balao with his wife Cristina. They have no children yet but hope to soon. He is in the farming business and at the same time raises hogs to sell for additional income. He has been doing this for over five years now. He still wants to improve his hog raising business, which is why he is asking for a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He will buy feeds, vitamins and medicines for his hogs. These will help Orlando's hogs to grow healthier, thus offer at a higher price upon distribution. 

Someday he would like to keep growing as a successful businessman with his farm and backyard hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and medicines for his hogs.

loans.name: Elwindee

texts.en:
Elwindee is a 31 year old woman, and she is a dealer of rice in the village. Her business began more than two years ago working alone. She enjoys her business because this was a big factor in providing their needs. Though she feels difficulties sometimes due to the debt of her neighbors that was prolonging their debt before paying.

Because of this, she would like request a loan amount of P8,000 to buy additional stocks of rice and vegetables. She just hopes that her target market will increase in order to increase her sales. It would then let her save for the future of her two children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 31 is requesting a loan in order to expand her piggery business. An amount of P6,000 will purchase two piglets to raise and fatten up, vitamins for the good health and feed. This will help her to be more profitable and successful.

She believes that with hard work, she will been able to improve her family's financial status as well as the educational purposes of her three children.

loans.use: purchase two piglets to raise and fatten up, vitamins for good health and feed.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida 56, usually sells fruits and vegetables for a profitable price in the village. These products are very healthy and popular which leads into high demand. This encourages her to ask for a loan in the amount of P 7,000 to buy additional fruits and vegetables such as fresh squash, eggplant and banana.

She hopes to attract more customers for her to acquire higher income for the betterment of their poor living.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables such as fresh squash, eggplant and banana.

loans.name: Gregoire

texts.en:
Gregoire is 55 years old and is married with five children aged between 12 and 18 years old. He sells various goods such as clothes, lotions, beans, sugar, soap, etc. This is his thirteenth year in this business.
 
Gregoire has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, clothes, beans, sugar, soap, etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, beans, clothes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 35 years old and is single. For the past four years, he has owned a barber shop business. He works from from 6 am until 8 pm every day and has four people to help him.

Faustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his barber shop by purchasing more chairs, new machines, and other items for his salon. With the profits from his loan, he will be able to save for his future, pay medical insurance and be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to expand his barber shop by purchasing new machines and chairs

loans.name: Shaheen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen bibi is married with six children. Two of her children are enrolled in a nearby school and the others are free and don't do anything. Shaheen bibi and her husband are involved in a livestock business. Her husband purchases animals from the markets and raises them to sell at a profit. Shaheen bibi and her husband are very experienced in their business and have been operating it for over ten years.  She is a very efficient woman who finishes her household responsibilities on time and gives the required time to the animals. She keeps their place clean and gives them timely food and water. 

Shaheen is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to expand her animal sales business. With her loan, she and her husband will buy goats and animal food. They are hopeful that this loan investment will help them to increase their sales and income. In this photo, the lady holding the Asasah passbook is Shaheen bibi.

loans.use: to buy goats and animal food for her livestock business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia de 54 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Félix su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Alejandro y William a quienes cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cullpa Alta. El trabajo al que se dedica está anegada mujer es variado. En las mañanas trabaja como personal de limpieza en la gobernación de su localidad, donde recibe un sueldo mensual, ya por las tardes se dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos de maíz, papa y habas; los cuales comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde es muy conocida por la calidad de sus sembríos. Los fines de semana vende flores ornamentales en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad, donde gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo logró adquirir, es su mayor bien y lo aprovecha vendiendo flores hermosas para toda ocasión, cuenta que viaja una vez al mes al capital del país a comprar diversas variedades, ya es conocida pues tiene 12 años dedicándose a esto. Pero como aprovecha toda las oportunidades que tiene, también cría animales como ovejas, cerdos y vacas, que después vende a mayor precio, cuando estén maduras. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Eugenia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de flores para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 54, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Félix, her husband of twenty years.  They have two children, Alejandro and William who she cares for in her own house located in Cullpa Alta.  

The work this beloved woman does is varied.  In the morning she works as part of the cleaning staff at city hall earning a monthly salary and in the afternoon she cares for her corn, potato and lima bean crops which she sells in the city of Huancayo’s wholesale market where she’s very well known for the quality of her crops.  

On weekends she sells ornamental flowers at a centrally-located spot in the city which she was able to acquire thanks to her effort and work.  It’s her greatest asset and she takes advantage of it selling beautiful flowers for all occasions.  She relates that she travels to the nation’s capital once a month to buy various varieties.   She’s well known since she’s been doing this for 12 years.  But, because she avails herself of all opportunities that arise, she also raises sheep, pigs and cows that she then sells at higher prices when they are mature.

She belongs to the “Manos Fuertes” (Strong Hands) communal bank and this is the 15th loan with MFP where she feels empowered because she gets help to progress in her business.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments because of this.  She also enjoys working in her communal bank because they are responsible, mutually supportive people.

If Eugenia were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy flowers for her business.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and is married with four children between the ages 10 and 13. For the past year, he has owned a business where he sells local drinks. Samuel's business is open from 6 am until 9 pm every day and he has four people to help him. 

Samuel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase large quantities of local drinks to sell. With the profits from his loan, he will be able to save for the future and to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase local drinks to sell

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net (in the photo), age 28, and her husband, Sophors, age 29, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometres away. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters who attend school. 

Net is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. Additionally, she operates a business renting out a space of her house to garment workers. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to repair her rooms and assist in her mother’s grocery inventory by buying more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: to repair her home and buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Yssa

texts.en:
Yssa is a 29 year old woman who sells coconut, bananas and vegetables as a source of income. She has been doing this for almost three years and is enjoying her occupation. With the patience and hard work, she is slowly improving their poor situation.

Right now, she is asking for a loan of P 6,000 to purchase bananas and vegetables as additional products to sell. She believes that her available loan would be a help to her in generating higher income.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and vegetables.

loans.name: C20010 Abatiganda Group

texts.en:
Clavert is 32 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. He works as a farmer and sells rice. Clavert is a leader of this group which is called "C20010 Abatiganda" in the local language. In this photo he is raising his hand. Clavert has been running his business for the past five years and he works from 6 am through 2 pm during the week. He currently employs ten people to help him. 

Clavert is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his agriculture business buy purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future, pay school fees for his children, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell

loans.name: Margarette Nathaniel's Group

texts.en:
Margarette Nathaniel is 43 years old, married, and has six children. Four of her children are free and two read in a nearby school.  

Margarette belongs to a family of farmers. She started her own business after her marriage and now she is running an animal sales business with her husband. Both are very supportive toward each other. They love doing this work and care much for their cattle. 

They purchase young animals from the animal market at low rates and sell them for a good price after raising them. In this way, they run the financial circle of their family. 

Margarette has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for their own business. With the loan, they will buy animals (goats) and animal food for the further expansion of their business.
 
They are hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to their business.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal food for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea (in the photo) is a motor-taxi driver, while his wife, Mala, is a garment worker. In addition, they rent out part of their house to other garment workers because their house is located near the factory. The couple has been married since 1996 and they have one son and three daughters. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Chea has received Kiva loans twice. He is now asking for his third loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for his wife to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for his wife to get work

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Walter de 58 años, hace 30 años unió su vida junto a Esperanza, la madre de sus 2 hijos. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la localidad de Yapaz Bajo, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo. La agricultura es su principal actividad económica. Así logró sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, de los cuales se refiere con mucho orgullo; pues heredaron su oficio. En sus 15 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café y plátanos, aprendió a invertir y distribuir de buena manera su dinero. Ahora con mucho orgullo, resume que es uno de los mejores agricultores de la zona. En cada cosecha de café vende sus granos maduros a una empresa de producción muy reconocida de la zona, así obtiene buenas ganancias. De esa manera instaló una tienda de comestibles en un pequeño espacio de su casa, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad. Además posee un pequeño taller de carpintería donde fabrica, muebles y demás productos a base de madera. Ahora el quiere invertir en mejorar su negocio, para poder descansar en su vejez. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 que recibiría, gracias a su ayuda de MFP. Se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “El Palomar al éxito” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Walter, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus cultivos de café, que cosechará a partir de mayo.
texts.en:
Walter, 58, joined his life to Esperanza, the mother of his two children.  They live in their own house in Yapaz Bajo, San Luis de Shuaro-Chanchamayo District.  His main economic activity is farming.  This is how he raised his two children who he refers to with much pride because they inherited his occupation.  

n his 15 years’ experience growing coffee and bananas, he learned how to invest and distribute his money well.  Now, with much pride he states that he’s one of the best farmers in the area.  He sells each harvest of ripe coffee beans to a very well known production firm in the area obtaining good profits this way.  He was able to set up a grocery store in a small space at home where he sells basic staple items.  He also has a small carpentry shop where he manufactures furniture and other products made from wood.  Now, he wants to improve his business so that he can rest in his old age.

This would be loan #5 received thanks to MFP.  He commits once more to make his installment payments.  He enjoys being part of his “El Palomar al Éxito” communal bank because all its members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.

If Walter were to receive your support, he will use the requested money to buy several sacks of organic manure to fertilize his coffee plants that will be harvested starting in May.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (pictured above) is 29 years old and her husband, Puthea, is 30 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometres away, and have one son who is in school.

Sokha is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to get  to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to get to work

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat (in the photo), age 36, is a scarf weaver. Her husband, Roeun, age 30, is a garment worker. They live on an island off the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and they have just one young son.

Sinat is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her scarf-weaving business

loans.name: Aoeurn

texts.en:
Aoeurn and his wife, Soeurn, are farmers. They grow lotus and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Aoeurn is applying for a loan of $1,500 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain his farm.

Aoeurn and his wife have been married since 1985 and they have four children - one son and three daughters. One is a garment worker, another is a security guard, another attends school, and another assists her parents in the farming business. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides to maintain his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children who are in school.

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Ing and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Ing is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain his farm. He will also use a part of the loan to buy pesticide applicators.     

The couple lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons - two assist their parents in farming and the other one is in high school.

Photo: Ing and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pesticide applicators

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis de 44 años, vive con sus padres: Luis e Isabel, quienes son ancianos, por eso los cuida con cariño en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Yapaz Bajo, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro – Chanchamayo.  Elvis tiene un hijo: Airton, de 17 años de edad y a pesar de que no viva junto a él; lo ama y hace todo lo posible para brindarle una buena calidad de vida. Es por ello que hace 15 años, compró 10 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra café y plátanos en grandes cantidades. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es estar en el campo, cultivando y cuidando los sembríos que pronto darán frutos. Según cuenta en épocas de cosecha, se dedica al acopio de café, para eso compra y vende a una empresa de producción, obteniendo así un dinero extra que suma también a la comercialización de sus propios granos. Pero la actividad a la que dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, es el negocio de cabinas de Internet, locutorio (donde se hacen llamadas telefónicas) y cabinas de proyección de películas. Le va muy bien, ya que en la zona no existe una igual, logrando así ser él único en su rubro. Por ello está pensando mejorar cada día en la atención y en el servicio. Éste sería su crédito número 5 que recibiría de MFP, espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “El Palomar al Éxito” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables. Elvis, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del mantenimiento de sus máquinas. Además comprará algunas bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Elvis is 44 years old and lives with his parents: Luis and Isabel. As they are old, he is lovingly caring for them in his own house, located in the town of Yapaz Bajo, San Luis de Shuaro district - Chanchamayo. Elvis has one son, Airton, of 17 years of age. Although they don't live together, Elvis loves him and does everything possible to provide him with a high quality of life. 

It was for this reason that, 15 years ago, Elvis bought 10 hectares of land, where he plants coffee and bananas in large quantities. What he likes most about agriculture is being in the fields, growing and taking care of the plants that will soon bear fruits. During the harvest season Elvis stocks up coffee, thus he buys and sells to a production company. This way he gains extra money, on top of trading his own beans. 

But the activity on which he spends most of his time is his shop of internet booths, phone booths, and movie showing booths. He is doing very well, as there isn't any other such shop in the area; he is the only one in this trade. For that, he is thinking every day on how to improve customer support and the level of service.  

This will be his fifth loan received from MFP. Elvis counts on its collaboration to be able to realize his plans. He commits, one more time, to fulfill the payment for his installments, as he did with his previous loans. He is also pleased to be a member of his communal bank "El Palomar al Éxito", as all its members are responsible people.  

Elvis, when obtaining this support, will invest the requested money into paying for his machines' maintenance. He will also buy some sacks of organic compost, to fertilize his coffee plantation.

loans.use: To pay for his machines' maintenance and to buy sacks of compost

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun (in the photo), age 53, is a widow mother with one son and three daughters. One child has full-time employment in a hotel, two are housekeepers, and another one is in school. They live on an island off Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokkhoeun cooks typical Khmer desserts and sells them in her village. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $400 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to get to work

loans.name: Chan Thoeun

texts.en:
