Transportando las mercancías en un coche arrastrado por un caballo, se le ha presentado el problema de la enfermedad de su caballo, es por esto que busca que un préstamo que le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un caballo y realizar mantenimiento a su coche. 
Gustavo espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados por la compra de un nuevo caballo, y así poder seguir generando los ingresos que requiere el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gustavo tiene el sueño de poder generar buenos ingresos para su familia y conseguir en un futuro su propia casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
From a very early age, Gustavo has transported materials.  His family has made a living this way for several generations.  Thanks to this, Gustavo has a great knowledge in the city, and this lets him make good sales.  Gustavo works hard every day with the motivation of taking good care of his wife and 6-year-old son.  His wife is also 8 months pregnant.  With Gustavo's job, he generates the necessary income for his home, and he offers his family a good quality of life.  He transports merchandise in a horse-drawn cart, but he faces the problem of his horse being sick.  This is why he is looking for a loan that will offer him the opportunity to buy a horse and maintain his cart.

Gustavo hopes that in this way, his monthly income won't be affected by buying a new horse, and he will be able to keep generating the income that he needs to support his home.  Gustavo's dream is to be able to keep making income for his family, to have his own home in the future, and to take good care of his children.

loans.use: to buy a horse and to maintain his cart.

loans.name: Berta Amparo

texts.es:
Berta es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Berta se encuentra casada y es madre de 11 hijos, a quienes ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Con el ánimo de generar ingresos extras, debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, montó un negocio de fabricación de arepas con el cual genera ingresos para contribuir junto con su esposo a los ingresos para su hogar. De esta manera, Berta ha podido contribuir considerablemente para que su familia goce de una mejor calidad de vida y de mejores oportunidades económicas. El negocio de Berta ha tenido muy buena acogida entre sus clientes y ha podido tener muy buenos niveles de ventas gracias a esto, por lo que Berta cada vez ha ido incrementando la producción de su negocio para atender los pedidos que le hacen. Con el ánimo de realizar algunas mejoras a su negocio, Berta busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas en su fogón y comprar una máquina de moler.
Berta espera que de esta manera la capacidad de producción de su negocio aumente y de esta manera pueda satisfacer todos los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, además, espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Berta is a very hardworking person who always wants to give her family a better quality of life.  Berta is married and the mother of 11 children, whom she has gotten ahead with great effort.  With the intention of generating extra income, because her husband's income was not sufficient to maintain the household, she set up a business making "arepas" [cornmeal rolls] with which she generates income to contribute with her husband to the household income.  In this way Berta has been able to contribute considerably so her family enjoys a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.

Berta's business has had a very good reception among her customers and she has had very good levels of sales thanks to this.  Berta has increased her business production more all the time to be able to attend to the orders made of her.

With the intention of making some improvements to her business, Berta looks for a loan to give her the opportunity to make improvements to her stove and to buy a machine for grinding.

Berta hopes that in this way the production capacity of her business increases and she can satisfy all the requests her customers have made of her.  In addition, she hopes that with greater income her family can enjoy a better quality of life and better opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to make improvements on her stove and to buy a machine for grinding.

loans.name: Daneira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Daneira se dedica a la venta de mercancía desde hace aproximadamente 12 años, cuando inició la labor en busca de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar con los cuales pueda ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Daneira es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo a quien su padre abandonó hace un tiempo sin ofrecer alguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento, lo que ha hecho que Daneira tenga una gran responsabilidad en su hogar para poder sacar su hijo adelante. Daneira ofrece principalmente productos de uso personal a sus clientes y lo complementa con algunos artículos de cocina y decoración. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece Daneira, su negocio ha sido muy bien conocido por parte de los habitantes de su sector. La principal dificultad que presenta Daneira es que no tiene un lugar fijo donde pueda ofrecer su mercancía, lo que hace que tenga que ofrecer sus productos en la calle y la gente no la pueda ubicar tan fácilmente. Con el ánimo de comprar una estantería y surtir mejor su negocio, Daneira busca un préstamo que le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una estantería y comprar productos de uso personal para surtir su negocio.
Daneira espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales aumenten considerablemente, puesto que sus clientes la podrán ubicar más fácilmente. Además, Daneira espera que la estantería que será ubicada en su hogar, sea el comienzo para adecuar un local en su vivienda donde pueda ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes. Daneira sueña con tener su negocio ubicado en un local propio y desde donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y con el cual le pueda ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Daneira has worked in the sale of goods since about 12 years ago, when she began her work in search of generating greater income for her home with which she could provide her son a better quality of life. Daneira is a single mother, head of the family with 1 child, whose father abandoned him some time ago without offering any economic contribution for his upbringing. This has made Daneira have a great responsibility in her home in over to get her child ahead. Daneira offers mainly personal care products to her clients and she complements them with some kitchen and decorating items. The main difficulty that Daneira faces is that she does not have a fixed location where she can offer her merchandise, so she has to offer her products in the street and people can't locate her as easily. With the aim to buy a stand and better stock her business, Daneira is looking for a loan that will offer her the opportunity to buy a stand and buy personal care products to supply her business. 

Daneira hopes that in this way her monthly income will increase considerably, given that her clients will be able to locate her more easily. Additionally, Daneira hopes that the stand, which will be located in her home, will be the beginning in order to provide a location in her home where she can offer better service to her clients. Daneira dreams of having her business located in its own location, from which she can generate employment for people who need it most, and from which she can offer her son a better quality of life and better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a stand and buy personal care products to stock her business.

loans.name: Henry De Jesus

texts.es:
Henry es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Henry se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijas de 1 y 4 años de edad, quienes son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Gran parte de su vida la ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó desde muy temprana edad. Gracias a esto, genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar y puede ofrecerle así una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Con la buena calidad que tienen sus cultivos, Henry ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes, lo que le ha garantizado un muy buen nivel de ventas. Con el ánimo de sacar su cultivo adelante, Henry busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de riegos y abono para su cultivo. 

Henry espera que de esta manera pueda sacar su cultivo de buena calidad y lo pueda ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, además, que con mayores ingresos podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Henry sueña con tener un gran negocio el cual sea reconocido y desde el cual pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas, además, sueña con ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus 2 hijas.
texts.en:
Henry is a person who has characterized himself by being very hard-working and always wanting to offer his family a better quality of life.  Henry is married and has two daughters, who are one and four.  They are his motivation to work hard in his business.  He has dedicated a large part of his life to agriculture.  His father made a living this way and taught him it at a very early age.  Thanks to this, he makes the income necessary to support his home, and he can offer a good quality of life to his family.  With the good quality of his crops, Henry has managed to attract a number of customers, and he has guaranteed a good level of sales.  With the motivation of taking good care of his crops, Henry is looking for a loan that will offer him the possibility of buying irrigation and fertilizer for his crops.

Henry hopes that in this way, he can have a good quality crop and offer a good price to his customers.  He will also be able to offer a good quality of life to his family with better income.  Henry dreams about having a big business that is well-known where he can generate jobs for people who need them most.  He also dreams about offering a quality education to his two daughters.

loans.use: to buy irrigation and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Gilberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Gilberto es una persona que a pesar de las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Gilberto anteriormente tenía un taller de mecánica con el cual generaba empleo y desde el cual le podía ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, sin embargo, por conflictos de violencia en su municipio, se vio en la obligación de desplazarse hacia otro municipio dejando todo su trabajo de lado. Con el paso del tiempo su municipio ha mejorado la situación de violencia y ha podido retornar de nuevo hacia su propia vivienda. Allí, ha vuelto a montar su taller de mecánica de motos donde también tiene un almacén de venta de repuestos, y gracias a esto, ha vuelto a recuperar su negocio, su vivienda y la calidad de vida para su familia. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos y las reparaciones que realiza en su taller, Gilberto es una persona muy reconocida y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de buscar mayor productividad en su taller, Gilberto busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de trabajo para hacer su taller más productivo y poder cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes. 
Gilberto espera que de esta manera pueda ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor atención, y de este modo sus ventas aumenten considerablemente. Además, espera poder volver a generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y con lo cual pueda impactar la calidad de vida de muchas más personas. Gilberto tiene el gran sueño de tener un taller que sea autorizado por una marca de motocicletas reconocida y de esta manera pueda tener una mayor acreditación.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a person who, in spite of the adversities that life has presented to him, has had the fortitude to overcome them and continue to progress, together with his family. In the past, Gilberto had a mechanic's workshop with which he generated employment and through which he was able to offer his family a better quality of life. Nevertheless, because of violent conflicts in his community, he saw the need to move to another community, leaving all his work behind. With the passing of time, his community has improved the situation with regard to violence, and he was able to return again to his own home. There he has again set up his motorcycle workshop, where he also has a store where he sells parts, and thanks to this, he has re-established his business, his home, and the quality of life of his family. Thanks to the good quality of the products he sells and the repairs that he does in his shop, Gilberto is a well-known person, and this has permitted him to have very good sales. With the spirit to seek better productivity in his shop, Gilberto is looking for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy work tools that will make his shop more productive and allow him to fill all the orders of his customers.

Gilberto hopes that in this way he can offer his customers better service and thus his sales will increase considerably. In addition, he hopes to be able to again generate jobs for the people most in need and thus impact the quality of life of many more people. Gilberto has the great dream of having a shop that is authorized by a well-known brand of motorcycles, and in this way he can have better accreditation.

loans.use: to buy work tools to make his workshop more productive and allow him to fill the orders of his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the fabric that she needs to make her clients' orders.

loans.name: Horacio De Jesus

texts.es:
Horacio es una persona que siempre ha tenido la fortaleza de superar las grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, y gracias a esto ha podido seguir progresando junto a su familia. Horacio se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 6 y 10 años de edad, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Hace más de 10 años Horacio se dedica al transporte de materiales en una carroza halada por un caballo, sin embargo, debido a circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad, se vio en la obligación de dejar a un lado esta actividad y trabajar como empleado durante un tiempo. Gracias a que ha superado su dificultad, quiere retomar con su actividad de transportar materiales, la cual la hace como independiente y esto le genera mayores ingresos. Como ya tiene el coche de madera, Horacio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un caballo con el cual pueda retomar su actividad del transporte de materiales. 

Horacio espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues durante el tiempo que trabajó como empleado su salario era muy bajo y no le alcanzaba para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. Horacio tiene el sueño de que su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y también sueña con tener su casa propia y sacar adelante con un buen estudio a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Horacio is a person who has always had the strength to overcome the great adversities that he has faced in life.  Thanks to this, he has been able to keep progressing with his family.  He is married and has three children, who are three, six, and ten.  They have always been his motivation to work hard in his business.  For more than ten years, he has made a living transporting materials in a horse-drawn cart.  Nevertheless, due to circumstances outside of his control, he saw the need to stop this work and work as an employee for someone else for awhile.  Since he has overcome the problem, he wants to take up his transportation business again, which will make him independent and let him make more income.  Since he already has his wood cart, he is looking for a loan that will offer him the opportunity to buy a horse that will let him take up his business again.

Horacio hopes that in this way, his income will increase considerably.  During the time that he worked for someone else, his wages were very low and he wasn't able to cover all of his family's needs.  Horacio's dream is that his family can have a better quality of life.  He also dreams about having his own home and letting his three children get ahead by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy a horse so he can take up his business of transporting materials again.

loans.name: Javier Honorio

texts.es:
Javier es una persona rebuscadora que entre varias actividades ha conseguido generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Javier es padre de 4 hijos quienes están a su cargo debido a que su madre los abandonó hace un tiempo, lo que hace que toda la responsabilidad caiga sobre Javier y les deba garantizar la mejor calidad de vida posible. Gracias a la amabilidad que lo caracteriza, y al buen servicio que ofrece, Javier es reconocido en su municipio y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. Javier se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, y al transporte de mercancía o acarreos cuando sus clientes se lo piden. Gracias a que cuenta con un carro el cual tiene un gran espacio para el transporte de estas mercancías, Javier tiene una ventaja sobre su competencia lo que hace que a menudo sea preferido entre las demás personas. Con el ánimo de implementar el sistema de gas para su vehículo, Javier busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a equipar su vehículo con el sistema de gas para ahorrar en el gasto que tiene de combustible. 
Javier espera que de esta manera sus ingresos no se consuman tan rápidamente, pues ya no tendrá que gastar grandes sumas de dinero en combustible para su vehículo. Javier sueña con tener un buen negocio y con ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación que lo prepare para un empleo que sea bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Javier is an instinctive person who has been able to generate the necessary income to support his family through various activities.  He is the father of four children for whom he cares since their mother abandoned them awhile ago.  This means that all of the responsibility of guaranteeing them the best quality of life possible falls to Javier.  Thanks to his friendliness and the good service that he offers, Javier is known in his town, and this lets him have very good sales.  Javier buys and sells wood and transports merchandise for customers that ask him to.  Thanks to having his own cart, he has a large space to transport this merchandise, which gives him an advantage over his competition, which often makes him preferred by many people.  Javier is looking for a loan that will let him implement his vehicle with a gas system that will save him fuel costs.

He hopes that in this way, his income will not be consumed so quickly.  He will not have to spend large amounts of money on gas for his vehicle anymore.  He dreams about having a good business and offering his children a good education that prepares them for good-paying jobs.

loans.use: to equip his vehicle with a gas system that will save him on fuel costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products such as cold cuts and groceries to increase the variety of products she sells to her customers.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 54 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère  3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 16 et 33 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce  d’effets de  femmes.  C’est une activité  qu’elle a démarré juste après sa retraite, sous l’influence   de son frère commerçant.  L’étape  la plus importante pour elle  dans son activité est l’étape ou elle fait le choix de ses produits. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’effets de femmes a revendre. Son intention est d’augmenter son fond de roulement et d’accroitre ses profits et  relever le niveau de vie familial.
texts.en:
Madame Aminata lives in Senegal. She is 54 years old. She is a divorced woman and mother of three children between the ages of 16 and 33. 

She is in the business of selling women's products. She stared this business just after she retired, under the influence of her merchant brother. The most important step for her in her business is choosing her products. She is a member of her local branch of U-IMCEC and is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs, which she plans to use to purchase women's products for resale. 

She aims to increase her working capital as well as her profits, and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: acheter des effets de femmes a revendre

loans.name: Maria Elicenia

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y esto le ha permitido superar las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Maria es una madre soltera de 1 hijo quien siempre ha sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio, y a quien su padre abandonó desde hace un largo tiempo. Con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Maria decidió montar su propio negocio el cual es una venta de prendas de vestir para dama, y con el cual ha podido generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su negocio siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer prendas de muy buena calidad y por ofrecer un muy buen servicio. Con el ánimo de ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos en su negocio, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para dama y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Maria espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, además de que su hijo podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Maria sueña con tener un gran negocio y ubicarse en un lugar más amplio y donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Maria is a person who has always been characterized as very hardworking, and this has allowed her to overcome the adversities that have come her way in life. Maria is a single mother of one son whose father left them a long time ago. Her son has always been her motivation for working hard at her business. With the intention of generating enough income to sustain her household, Maria decided to start her own business which is selling women's clothing. This has allowed her to make enough money to maintain her home. Her business has always been known for offering good quality garments and very good service. 

With the desire to offer a greater variety of products, Maria is looking for a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy women's clothing.  Maria hopes that this will help her income increase considerably so that her son can have a better quality of life. Maria dreams of having a large business and a bigger store where she can create jobs for people in greater need.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Sophy is a 42-year-old mother of two dependent sons who are still in school. For the survival of the rest of the family, she and her husband have been farming for 20 years as the primary source of income. Additionally, her husband also works as a construction worker to earn more income. Sophy joined VisionFund in 2010 for her first loan cycle and successfully repaid back her entire loan. The loan has improved her lifestyle standard which is better than before and she has also managed to build some savings for future needs. She can now earn about US$4 per day. With the satisfactory result of the previous loan, she is confidently in requesting a new loan with another member in the amount of 1,200,000 each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her dry season rice farming. She hopes to generate more income so as to build a new house, keep both of her sons in school, and have some saving for future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her dry season rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia bibi is a 46-year-old married woman and by this relationship, she has three children who are now grown. Safia runs a business of selling blankets & clothes. She purchases these items from different cities and sells to her community areas and to different shops of the markets. 
She does this work to supplement the income of her family. Her husband is an employee in a private firm and on a monthly wage.  
Safia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. She will utilize the loan in buying of clothes and blankets in larger quantity for reselling. 
She is hopeful that her business will earn her better profits after investing the loan into it. 

Note: In the picture, one of the members is showing her toys selling business.

loans.use: To buy clothes & blankets for reselling

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma, el cual le ha permitido ofrecerles a las demás personas una mejor calidad de vida y el cual le ha permitido ganarse el afecto de una gran cantidad de personas. Maria tenía el sueño de poder brindarles a las personas de otros municipios que querían estudiar en su municipio, la oportunidad de encontrar un lugar donde se pudiesen hospedar con tarifas mucho más bajas a las que se encuentran en los hoteles comunes. De esta manera Maria abrió su hogar comenzó a alquilar algunas habitaciones de su vivienda para personas con muy bajos recursos de otros municipios que buscaban en su municipio una mejor educación. Gracias a esta actividad, Maria genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye en su hogar a la generación de ingresos y de esta manera les ofrece a sus 3 hijos y su esposo una mejor calidad de vida, al mismo tiempo que le mejora la calidad de vida y le ofrece mayores oportunidades a las demás personas. Además de esta actividad, Maria también ofrece productos de uso personal a través de catálogo, lo que le permite tener ingresos extras con los que puede ofrecer más a su familia. Con el ánimo de hacer sus labores de manera más productiva, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de electrodomésticos con los cuales pueda hacer su trabajo más productivo.

Maria espera que de esta manera pueda tener mayor productividad y poder atender a un mayor número de personas, de modo que sus ingresos aumente y también impacte la calidad de vida de más personas. Maria sueña con en un futuro no muy lejano montar su propio restaurante y poder generar empleo par las personas más necesitadas y desde el cual le pueda ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is a person who has always been known to be very charismatic, which has helped her win the affections of a great number of people and improve their quality of life. Maria had a dream of being able to help people from other towns who wanted to study in her city, and got the opportunity by finding a place where she could house people at much lower rates than community hotels. In this way Maria opened up her home by renting out some rooms to out-of-towners with few resources who came to her city for a better education. Thanks to this activity, Maria has generated income to contribute to the household finances and offer her three children and her husband a better quality of life while at the same time improving the quality of life and providing better opportunities to others as well. In addition to this activity, Maria also sells personal-use products via catalog, which earns her extra income for her family. With the goal of doing her work more productively, Maria is requesting a loan so she can purchase household appliances that will make her job easier. Maria hopes that in this way she can increase her productivity and tend to a greater number of people, so she can grow her profits and also make an impact in more people's lives. Maria dreams in the not-too-distant future she can start up her own restaurant and provide employment to people in need while also improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase appliances to increase her productivity.

loans.name: Chheng Leang

texts.en:
Chheng Leang (in the photo), age 29, is a tailor. Her husband, Sophoun, age 34, is a motor taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from a motor taxi driver to a Tuk Tuk* driver, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence, Chheng Leang decided to ask for a loan of $1,000 to buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband. 

Chheng Leang and her husband live in the suburb of Phnom Penh City and they just have one young son. 

*three-wheeled motorcycle taxi

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband to drive as a Tuk Tuk taxi driver.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 29 years of age and still single. She dreams to have a successful business and have her own family some day. She engages herself in selling motorcycle parts and accessories to generates income. She has been operating this business for almost six years, earning a profits of P10,000 a month that she uses to spend on their food, clothing, and allowances of her younger brother and sister. 

She planned to improve the business and save more income for her future. But due to financial constraints, she is asking for additional capital of P15,000 to buy additional stock of motorcycle parts and accessories to sell. She hopes that through hard work, she will make an improvement in the business and will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of motorcycle parts and accessories to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza  is a 41-year-old piggery business owner who wants to feel progress in financial matters someday. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her children's schooling expenses are quite high, so Flordeliza is aiming for a higher profit.

In connection with this, Flordeliza is asking for a loan of 12,000 pesos to buy two additional pigs, feeds, and vitamins. She hopes that through her loan, she would provide enough allowances of her children as well as save for their everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy two additional pigs, feeds, and vitamins

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal (in the photo with his loom), age 48, is a widower. He lives with his sister in a village on an Island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal is a silk weaver. In addition, he also buys some silk fabrics from his fellow weavers and transports them to sell in other provinces. He is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for his silk weaving business. He will use a part of the loan to buy more silk products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his silk weaving business and to buy more silk products for resale.

loans.name: Nellieflor May

texts.en:
Nellieflor May is married and has three school-age children. With her husband, she plans to improve their living conditions and educate their children. To generate income, she is engaged in selling grocery items and cooking dishes to sell. She has been in this business for more than eight (8) years now. Her income is a great help to her family, especially for the education of her children. 

Despite hardships and competitors in the area, she can still manage the business well. She is requesting for an additional capital of PHP8,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables, ingredients and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the food stall. She believes that she will be able to make an improvement in the business through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables, ingredients and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the food stall.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea (in the photo), age 41, is garment worker. Her husband, Vantha, age 40, is a rice farmer. They have been married since 1992 and they have three children. Of their two sons and one daughter, one is a teacher and the other two are attending school. They family is living in a village about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phea is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, aged 50, makes a living by raising hogs. She has been doing this for over eight years. The income generated from selling of her hogs helped her to improve their living situation, especially towards the studies of her three children. She wants to continue to operate and develop her business. 

For this reason, Jocelyn is asking a loan of 8,000 to buy feed, hogs and medicines. In the future, Jocelyn hopes for to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, hogs and medicines.

loans.name: Nabeela Jamal's Group

texts.en:
Nabeela jamal is married woman, involved in a sewing & embroidery business. Her work is home based. She sews dresses with perfect measurement and crafts beautiful hand embroidery on dresses. Her customers are very much satisfied with her work. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. She has been doing this work for over 6 years. 

Nabeela has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy an embroidery machine and be able to complete more orders from her clients and to earn more income. She is sure that an embroidery machine will enable her to complete the orders on time and leave a good impact on her customers to order regularly.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Channang

texts.en:
Channang (in the photo with her loom), age 44, is single. She lives with her parents and sister and brother on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Channang is weaver. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun (pictured here), age 48, is a widow with eight children: three sons and five daughters. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Sokhoeun sells fish and fruits. She buys mangoes from her fellow villagers under contract. This means that she pays money before the harvesting season and then she collects mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market. 

Sokhoeun is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to expand her business buy by purchasing mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania is 52 years of age and she continuously operates her hog fattening business as a source of income. Her business is a great help in supporting her three children. Her children also help her in developing her business. 

Estefania then would like to acquire loan as additional working capital an amount of 10,000 pesos. It will be used in purchase of pigs and vitamins. She hopes that this time, she could be able to enlarge her profit for the welfare of family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and vitamins.

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mony (in the photo),48 years old, and his wife, Reaksmey, age 47, live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of the children are garment workers, one is a security guard and another attends school.  

Mony is a motorbike and bicycle repairman and he also grows rice when rice farming season comes. His wife raises pigs and produces rice wine. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm and to assist in his wife’s pig farming business by buying additional pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his rice farm and to assist in his wife’s pig farming business by buying additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sok Khea

texts.en:
Sok Khea (in the photo) is 32 years old and her husband, Thy, is 50 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and they have four children who are in school.  

Sok Khea sells grocery items in front of a garment factory, while her husband has full-time employment. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,300 to buy additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 42 years old. She is engaged in a piggery business, which is slowly helping to build up her sari-sari store. This is her way of helping her husband in generating income. With hard work and patience, she can now slowly reach her goal (to experience better living). To achieve it easier, she is asking for an additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used in the purchase of pigs and grocery items to be put in her store.

Mila hopes with a great development of her business, she will be able to gain higher profit.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and grocery items to be put in her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hard working woman who always aims to obtain greater profit for her family. She is 37 years of age, married and has been blessed with three children: one college student, an infant and the other one has settled into marriage.

Delia offers frozen foods, ingredients, vegetables, eggs and some junkfoods to her local community. Sometimes, she sells her frozen foods on a house to house basis. She is grateful because her patience and the sacrifices she has made have been fruitful in obtaining her goal in life. At this time, she spends greatly on school fees for her college student and expensive milk for her infant. For this reason, Delia would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP10,000, allowing her to buy more frozen foods,vegetables and some ingredients to be displayed in her stall "talipapa". She hopes that, through this loan amount, she can let her child finish her degree course while sustaining the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to be use in buying frozen foods,vegetables and some ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 51 years old and is married. She has two children. With the help of her piggery business, she can satisfy the family's daily necessities but not the needs of her children for school. Despite this, she patiently works hard in her business, hoping that will provide her a better income.

With the eagerness to gain enough income, Cecilia is asking for a loan of 15,000 pesos from ASKI that will be used to buy feeds, medicine and vitamins. She hopes that it will provide good results and let her earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicine and vitamins.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon (pictured here), age 41, is a tailor. Her husband, Bunthoeun, age 42, is an aide-de-camp. They have been married since 1987 and they have seven children. Of their five sons and two daughters, two are garment workers, two are construction workers and the other two attend school. The last one is still young. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Yon is in the process of building new house in which the family will live. Because she lacks some money to finish the house, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to finish her house building.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi, aged 40-years, is involved in a sewing business. Her work is home-based, which she does to support her family financially. She sews clothes for her neighbor-clients and charges PKRs 120 for a simple dress and PKRs 150 for a designer dress. The income she earns allows her to manage the financial expenses of her family.  

She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her daughter is the youngest one among the brothers. Her eldest son works in a factory. 
Allah Rakhi’s husband is a rickshaw driver. He offers his driving services to the passengers by dropping them at their destinations. He has set the fare route wise which is very affordable for his passengers. 

Allah Rakhi has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With the loan, she will buy unstitched clothes to sew so she can start selling the stitched clothes along with her sewing business. 

She is very much confident about the positive start up of her new activity with this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy unstitched clothes to sew & sell.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Maguette est une jeune célibataire de 28 ans qui habite dans l’une des banlieues de la communauté sénégalaise. Elle est démarcheur et pratique l’achat et la vente de matériels informatiques. Elle a une double activité de vente de produits cosmétiques et autres articles divers. Auparavant elle travaillait dans le domaine de l’informatique, et par ce biais elle a opté de continuer dans ce domaine. Son plus grand plaisir est la satisfaction des besoins de sa clientèle en répondant  à sa demande de plus en plus croissante dans le secteur ou elle habite. Elle est membre d’un  des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs. Son projet est de rendre formelle son activité. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu  pour s’inscrire au registre  de commerce, acquérir un NINEA et autres papiers nécessaires  pour l’exercice de son activité dans la légalité.  Son objectif principal  est de se doter d’une source de revenu qui lui permette de subvenir a ses besoins personnels  et  surtout financer ses études.
texts.en: Maguette is a young single lady, who is 28 years old and lives in one of the suburbs of the Senegalese community. She is a saleswoman and buys and sells computer equipment.  She has a second activity selling cosmetic products and other miscellaneous products. Previously she worked in the computer field, and thus chose to continue in this field. Her greatest pleasure is to be able to satisfy the needs of her ever-growing customer base in the area where she lives. She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs. Her plan is to formalize her business. She is thus requesting the 250,000 franc loan to register herself on the trade register, acquire a national commercial identification number (NINEA) and the other necessary documents to exercise her activity legally. Her main aim is to acquire a source of income which will enable her to provide for her personal needs, and above all, finance her studies.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of a trade register, a national commercial identification number and other documents.

loans.name: Ibra

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibra est un habitué de la caisse car il est à son 6ème prêt .Ibra est né en 1977, il est marié et père de famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires et de la vaisselle. Il a ouvert une boutique dans le marché. Il a une expérience de 12 ans dans ce domaine.
Il sollicite un crédit de 300000F CFA pour acheter des produits alimentaires : du sucre, du café, du lait, du chocolat, il vend aussi des cartes de crédit et de la vaisselle. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Il  a comme projet futur d’ouvrir une autre boutique.
texts.en: Ibra is a regular customer of the branch because he is on his sixth loan. He was born in 1977 and is married, as well as being a father. His business is selling food products and crockery. He has opened a shop in the market and has 12 years experience in this field. He is requesting a loan of 30,000FCFA to buy food products: sugar, coffee, milk, chocolate. He also sells credit cards and crockery. He takes care of his family's daily expenses. He plans to open another shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy food products and also to be able to sell crockery and credit cards

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr:
Agée de 56 ans, madame Marième s’active depuis 3 ans dans la vente de produits alimentaires. Elle a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle à bénéficier d’un crédit de 50000F CFA. Compte tenu de la possibilité d’emprunter une somme plus consistante en ouvrant un compte individuel, elle a préférer  l’ouvrir  pour demander un montant de 100000F CFA.
Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter du lait, du sucre, du thé et de la pate d’arachide pour revendre à ses clients qui font la commande avant qu’elle ne fasse le déplacement. Elle ne supporte aucune charge mais veut quand même améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille en donnant un coup de main à son époux qui gère la dépense journalière.
texts.en:
Marième is 56 years old and has been selling food products for the past three years. She was part of a group, in which she benefited from a loan of 50,000 FCFA. As a result of the possibility of borrowing a more substantial sum by opening an individual account, she preferred to opt for this to so that she could ask for a loan of 100,000FCFA. 

With this loan she is going to buy milk, sugar, tea and groundnut paste to resell to her customers, who order the products before she goes to them. She does not have any expenses, but would nevertheless like to improve her family's living conditions by giving her husband a helping hand with the management of the daily expenditure.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tea and groundnut paste for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a student taking a Bachelor of Commerce degree at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

I am Daniel, the firstborn in a family of four that includes myself, my sibling in primary school, and my two parents who are working in different professions. I come from a family with a business background and have a great interest in ethical business. Strathmore University integrates these in a single package and provides the opportunity to learn a curriculum with a difference in my country. I am currently in second year pursuing a Bachelor of Commerce degree with an interest in finance and management science.

I am applying for a loan to purchase a laptop that will be essential for my studies and convenient for data keeping for my future business undertakings. The laptop will be an essential part of my studies, both for the regular research that must be conducted and by providing access to the coursework.

I have a great interest in entrepreneurial activities. I have a dream of running a successful self-sustaining animal and bird farm which will create an avenue to fulfill my interest in real estate. I hope to attain financial stability by my late twenties. My philosophy is that I may be a slow walker but I never walk backward. I am a principled person guided by my own goals and objectives in life. I am adventurous and an achiever with a "go-getter” attitude. I love challenges in my day-to-day life. I am of the opinion that, if I want a better tomorrow, then I must start working on it today and now.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help in data keeping, research and accessing coursework.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman. She has five children. Her husband works as a fisherman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasiti operates an ingredients selling business and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanasiti will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. Mwanasiti aspires to expand the business by opening another shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of its flexible and affordable policies to meet customer needs.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story:

I am Noel, a student at Strathmore University pursuing a Bachelor of Commerce and Certified Public Accountant course. Strathmore University was my university of choice because of the discipline of its students and the dedication of its supporting staff and lecturers.

I am applying for a laptop to aid me with notes that are uploaded online through the University’s e-learning site. I wish to avoid the inconveniences that I experience while using the computer labs to download these notes. The labs are used for computer practicals that need minimal interference. I am not able to finance an outright purchase of a laptop and I have thus found this loan very handy. I hope to use this opportunity to better my academics. In the future, I hope to set up funds to help students who will be in the same financial position as I am in right now.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him access e-learning for his coursework.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story:

My name is Elizabeth. I have three brothers and one sister. I am a second year student doing a Bachelor of Commerce degree. I chose Strathmore University because it has a good, pleasant and clean environment; excellent learning facilities that include study rooms and a well-equipped library. Strathmore University also has recreation facilities and easy access to internet and helpful staff. 

I am taking out a laptop loan because my parents are currently in a financial crisis; hence, not able to buy me a laptop. My mother is unemployed and my father pays for all our school fees. The laptop will really help me do my assignments and access my courses on the e-learning site. After my graduation, I intend to start my own business utilizing what I have learnt in class.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help her do assignments and access her coursework on the e-learning site.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story:

I am Samuel from Nairobi, Kenya. I am from a family of six: that is my parents, my two brothers and a sister. I am a second year student at Strathmore University pursuing a Bachelor in Business and Information Technology degree. I chose to come to Strathmore because of its professionalism and expertise in teaching.

I am applying for a laptop loan because the course is getting to be more demanding. There are projects and assignments to be done and I have to read for exams. Currently, I only access my coursework when am at the University. Therefore, having a laptop will be more convenient, because I can do my coursework at home and; hence, manage my time better.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him with his projects, assignments and revision for exams

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story:

My name is Hosea. I live in Nairobi, Kenya, with both parents and two brothers. I chose Strathmore University because it is an institution which upholds high levels of discipline and the learning environment is conducive. Strathmore University instills ethical values which promote both personal and social development; thus, it was the university of my choice. I am currently in second year doing a Bachelor of Commerce which involves a lot of research, study and understanding of business-related issues. Finance is my major and it is something I pursue with a passion. 

I am taking out a loan for a laptop which I will use for research, making presentations, saving and backing up my work, and acquiring knowledge through access to many IT-related platforms. The world is currently in the digital age, and information is very vital to all who are going to take part in this revolution. With this loan, I will be able to acquire a laptop which I will use for access to information relevant to research for my courses. After I am done with my degree, I am hoping to secure a place in the job market. This is the dream of many university students. Afterwards, I plan to master or take CFA while I am working.

It is my dream that Kiva will continue with the work it is doing: making the dark days bright for students by giving them loans allowing them to add value to their lives, as well as promoting the spread of knowledge by creating access to information through loans for the purchase of laptops.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help with his research

loans.name: Mbua

texts.en:
Mbua is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Masha and he works as a air cabin crew. Mbua operates a cloth selling business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 1 year. Her primary customers are villagers. Mbua's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbua will use the Kes 25,000 loan to purchase rollers and cloth material for resale. Mbua aspires to open a cloth material depot in the future. She joined Yehu because of its loan products and policies.

loans.use: buy rollers and cloth materials

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que es reconocida en su sector gracias a la buena atención que ofrece en su negocio, el cual es una tienda general en la que ofrece toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar. El negocio lo inició hace aproximadamente 10 años gracias a que su madre le heredó el local donde tiene ubicada su tienda, el cual cuenta con muy buena ubicación para ser un referente para sus clientes. Con la buena calidad de sus productos, Maria ha podido captar un gran número de clientes, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas que le permiten ofrecer a su familia una muy buena calidad de vida. Debido a que su tienda ha ido creciendo en clientes, a su vez han venido creciendo las necesidades de los mismos, por lo que Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el ánimo de surtir su negocio y atender todas las necesidades de sus clientes.

Maria espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados por la compra de los productos de la canasta familiar, y le pueda seguir ofreciendo a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Maria sueña con tener buenos ingresos que le permitan ahorrar y poder ofrecerse en un futuro una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is well-known in her sector for the good customer service she offers at her general store, where she offers all kinds of products for the family shopping basket.  She started her business approximately ten years ago when she inherited from her mother the locale where the store is set up.  It is in a very good location and because of the quality of her products, Maria has been able to attract many customers.  This has allowed her to have a high sales volume and give her family a better quality of life.  Since the number of customers has been growing, their needs have also increased and Maria is requesting a loan to buy more essential products.  She wants to stock the store well and meet all her customers' needs.

Maria hopes her monthly income will not be affected by purchasing essential products, so she can continue giving her family a quality lifestyle.  Maria dreams of having a good enough income to be able to save so she can enjoy a more stable economy in the future.

loans.use: To buy essential goods and stock her store to meet customer needs.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que se decidió a montar su propio negocio y prosperar por su propia cuenta. Es por esto que luego de muchos años trabajando como operaria y supervisora de confecciones en una empresa, ha decidido trabajar independiente y generar sus propios ingresos y montar un negocio en el cual pueda generar empleo para las demás personas. Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 1 hijo a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una buena educación, por lo que últimamente ha venido trabajando muy fuerte para poder ofrecerle una educación universitaria. Debido a que María no cuenta con un gran capital, busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de la maquinaria básica y necesaria para montar su propio taller de confección. 

Maria espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá captar la utilidad de su negocio y no solo quedarse con un salario básico que es lo que le pagaban como empleada. Además, Maria espera que con mayores ingresos pueda contribuir más a los ingresos de su hogar y de esta manera su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida. Sueña con que su taller se posicione en el mercado y pueda tener una gran cantidad de clientes, además de poder ofrecer mucho empleo estable para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Maria is someone who has decided to set up her own business and get ahead on her own.  After many years of working as an operator and sewing supervisor at a company, she has decided to work independently and generate her own income.  Her idea is to set up a business and offer employment to other people.  Maria is married and has a son for whom she has always wanted to provide a good education.  Lately she has been working hard to give him a university education.  Since Maria does not have much capital, she is requesting a loan to buy the basic machinery she needs to set up her own sewing workshop.

Maria hopes to increase her monthly income considerably, and generate profits so she will not just have a basic salary like the one she received as an employee.  Her goal is to have a market presence and many customers, and offer stable employment to people who need it most.

loans.use: To buy basic machinery to set up her own sewing workshop.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy luchadora y gracias a esta cualidad ha podido sacar sus hijos adelante y continuar progresando a pesar de las grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Mariela se encuentra separada por lo que es una madre soltera de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les quiso ofrecer una buena educación. Sus 3 hijos ahora ya son jóvenes y adultos, por lo que no son una gran carga para Mariela, sin embargo, aún debe garantizarle a uno de ellos sus estudios universitarios. Mariela se dedica a la actividad de la confección, la cual aprendió desde hace mucho tiempo cuando laboraba para una empresa y de la cual decidió independizarse debido a que sentía que su trabajo era mal remunerado. En su taller, Mariela fabrica y repara toda clase de bolsos y esporádicamente calzado, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Con el ánimo de comprar insumos que requiere para su taller, Mariela busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos que requiere en su taller para la confección.

Mariela espera adquirir estos insumos sin que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados, y pueda seguir ofreciendo a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Mariela sueña con seguir teniendo la oportunidad de trabajar por su propia cuenta y siendo independiente en la generación de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mariela has always been known for her determination, thanks to which she has been able to provide for her children and continue getting ahead despite the many great challenges she has had to face in her life.  Mariela is divorced and the single mother of three children for whom she wants to provide a good education.  Her three children are young adults, so they are not a great burden for Mariela, but she still has to pay for a university education for one of them.  Mariela is in the sewing business.  She learned the skill years ago when she worked for a company, but then decided to work for herself because she did not feel she was being paid well.  In her workshop, Mariela makes and repairs handbags and, sometimes, shoes.  She is able to generate enough income for her household.  In order to buy supplies for her workshop, Mariela is seeking a loan to buy sewing supplies for her shop.

She is hopeful the purchase will not affect her monthly income so she can continue giving her family a good quality of life.  Her goal is to continue working on her own and being able to generate an income independently.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her workshop.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por su gran carisma y ser muy trabajador. Mario se encuentra casado y es padre de 5 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer la mejor educación posible. Mario se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a las actividades de la agricultura, gracias a que su padre se dedicó a esta actividad y se la enseñó desde muy temprana edad. Actualmente, Mario se dedica a la actividad de la comercialización de legumbres, frutas y verduras en la plaza de mercado de su ciudad, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Mario es muy reconocido por la buena atención que ofrece, y gracias a esto ha podido garantizar muy buena clientela que le producen muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, Mario busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de legumbres, frutas y verduras para surtir su negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Mario espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender mejor sus clientes y esto se traducirá en mejores ventas. Además, Mario espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Mario has always been known for being charismatic and a hard worker.  He is married with five children, and has always tried to provide them with the best education possible.  Mario has spent much of his life working in agriculture, thanks to his father who taught him the trade when he was very young.  Currently, Mario is in the business of selling legumes, fruits and vegetables in the city market.  Through his business he is able to generate enough income to support his household.  Mario is famous for the good customer service he offers, which means he has many good customers and a high sales volume.  In order to stock his business well, Mario is seeking a loan to buy legumes, fruits and vegetables.  His aim is to offer more variety to his customers.

He is hoping to increase his sales considerably by giving his customers better service.  Mario also wants to increase his income so the family can have a better lifestyle and more economic opportunities.

loans.use: To buy legumes, fruits and vegetables to offer more variety to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn and her husband are farmers. She has nine children - four sons and five daughters. Seven of her children are married and live separately, and the other two still live with her and her husband. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

One of Korn’s sons is a motor taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi driver to Tuk Tuk driver, because it (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence, she has decided to apply for her first loan in the amount of $1,300 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son-in-law. She will also to use a part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

In this photo, Korn is at her home. Although she may look old, she is still able and strong enough to continue to work to better the living situation for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk taxi for her son-in-law to drive and to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, aged 39, is very hard-working and has a grocery store selling basic products such as spices, sugar, cookies, biscuits and soft drinks. She has been doing this work for two years. Her store is easily seen by her customers and that causes her to acquire higher income from sales every day.

To provide better customer service as well as to provide for her family's needs, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 12,000 pesos to buy bread, salt, vinegar, cooking oil and bar soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread, salt, vinegar, cooking oil and bar soap.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a mother of five children - four daughters and one son. All of her kids are young and getting an education. Her husband is a sweetmeat maker and runs his sweetmeat shop in the market. He is very experienced in his profession and has a good reputation among his clients for his good quality and taste.  

Asia herself owns & operates a sewing business at her home. She receives orders from clients in her community and charges with PKRs 120 for a simple dress & PKRs 150 for a designer dress. Her clients are very satisfied with her work and never argue on charges. Asia has been contributing to the family financially for the past many years. Her family respects her and loves her a lot for her sincere and caring nature.
 
She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy unstitched clothes to sew so she can start selling the stitched clothes in addition to her sewing business. She is very confident about the positive start up of her new activity with this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes for sewing & selling.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie has been involved in a motorcycle transport services business for almost eight years. Her spouse is the driver of their own motorcycle, and each month he earns approximately P7,200. According to her, the profits generated from the transportation business is not enough to cover all of their daily expenses due to the high cost of basic commodities, school fees for their child and daily maintenance of their livestock business.

In this situation, she is in need of additional capital in the amount of P10,000. She will be using this loan amount for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle to ensure the safety of the passengers and to purchase accessories for better service. Merlie is hoping that she can earn greater profits to further save some amount for the bright future of her only child and to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to repair and maintain their motorcycle and to buy accessories for better service.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a small village in the Thmor Koul district, Kan is a 50-year-old mother of seven children. She has to be responsible for five children, two of whom are still in school. For the sake of this big family, she has been farming for 10 years.

Kan took the first loan from VisionFund in 2009 and successfully paid back the entire loan, which has made her a better living, as she can grow her paddy timely and produce more crop yield. She now can earn about US$10 per day.

She leads a new group with two other members. They are requesting a new loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for dry season rice farming on two-hectares of farmland. She hopes to earn more income and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for dry season rice on two-hectares of farmland.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
A 50-year-old mother of two dependent children who work as garment factory workers, Nhor is the breadwinner of her family that lives in one of the rural villages of the Prey Chor district in Kampong Cham province. The common business in her residential area is rice farming, and it is also the main source of income for Nhor's family as well. She has been with this business for 16 years and can save about US$1.5 per day. To earn more extra income, her husband works as a motor taxi driver in his spare time from farming.

Nhor has just joined VisionFund as a first cycle client. Her group loan consists of another four members, and she has been selected as the group leader. She and her group members are requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. For Nhor, she will use her loan to buy fertilizers and seed, and to hire labor for plowing her farmland. She hopes that her family's condition will be gradually improved.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seed, and to hire labor for plowing her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is a mother of five children, four of whom are still her responsibility as they are still in school. She is 40 years old and living in one of the remote villages of the Prey Chor district in which rice farming is one of the common businesses. She is a farmer who has been experiencing planting her rice paddy for 20 years to make living. To better feed her family, she also works for others for pay. 

In 2011, Kea took her first loan with Visionfund. She succeeded in paying back the loan and she now can earn about US$3.4 per day. The loan has made her a better living, enabled her to save some money, and provided her a proper shelter. Now, she is happy to take a new loan from VisionFund as the leader of the group that consists of another two members. She is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy fertilizer for her dry season rice farming. She hopes that she can keep her children in school and can build a new house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her dry season rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bunroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Bunroeurn, 44, is a widowed mother of four children. Out of her four children, she has to be responsible for only three children. Some of them are still in school while some are helping the family’s businesses. She grows rice, vegetables and rubber in order to strive for her big family as the single mother. She has 20 years of experience in rice farming and 5 years in the rubber planting business. From these various businesses, she can earn about US$4 per day. 

Bunroeurn has never been with VisionFund before. She joined the group with another two members as the group leader. She is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation. She hopes to earn more income from her rubber plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila is 30-year-old lady involved in a clothes sales business. She purchases clothes from different cities and sells to her neighboring clients and clothing shops for a good profit. She has obtained a good reputation among her clients for the good quality & design of the clothes she sells.  

She has been operating her business for over 4 years. Although these few years are considered to be for the establishment of her business, Shakila’s good business sense and dealing with customers has developed to a good level which is now giving her benefits in the shape of money & respect. 

She has now requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes sales business. She will invest the loan in the purchasing of clothes in larger quantities and with different variety for reselling. She is expecting good revenue from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
At 56 years old, Pov is a mother of four independent children who live independently. To make a living, she has been planting potatoes for five years as her core business. Additionally, she also raises pigs for a secondary income. 

She has been with VisionFund for the past two cycles already and completely repaid back each loan. The loans have made her a better living. Now, she is forming a group loan with another member to apply for the new loan. She is requesting a new loan of KHR 1,000,000, while her member is applying for KHR 100,000. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer for plowing her potato field. She hopes to earn more income for both businesses and improve her standard of living more than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer for plowing her potato field.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
To augment her spouse's income, Zenaida opened up a sari-sari (variety) store five years ago and is still managing it now. She is very happy to offer friendly services and affordable prices to her customers. 

She would like to improve her sales, so she is asking for an additional capital of P7,000 to buy noodles, biscuits, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell in her store. Someday, with good sales and regular customers, Zenaida will improve her store and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is a hard-working woman who buys and sells fruit and vegetables. She sells in the barrio through walking and has a stand in the market every market day.  She sells door-to-door in order to earn a higher income. This is for her family which is in need of higher income, most especially for her three school-aged children. 

Arcely wants to expand the products she offers. To do this, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fruit such as pineapple and vegetables. She hopes that it will be approved so that she may earn a higher income as well as to improve the family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as pineapple and vegetables

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora lives at Anquiray with her spouse and five children. She devotes herself full time to attending to customers' needs for grocery items. Aurora has been managing her sari-sari (variety) store for almost 10 years. Through her income, she provides the daily needs of her family. 

Now, she is asking for a loan to invest in more grocery items to sell. She is asking for P20,000 and will buy sardines, soft drinks, noodles, breads and eggs to sell in her store. 

Aurora's dream is to make her business more profitable for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, soft drinks, noodles, breads and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Onofre

texts.en:
Onofre is 32 years of age, happily married and blessed with three children. His source of providing the needs of his family is his hog raising business that is currently in need of additional funds to provide complete care. So, Onofre is asking for a loan of P4,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs. 

Through this contribution, and accompanied by his hard work, he can certainly dispose of his hogs at a higher price soon. He believes that his business will lift him up from his poor living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is contented living with his wife and two children. He has run and managed his hog-raising business for 11 years. He plans to obtain more hogs to fatten in order to grow his sales and to meet his family's needs. But due to deficient capital, he is asking for financial assistance from lenders in the amount of P7,000 to buy two more hogs, vitamins, medicines and feeds. He would be so happy and more contented if his requested loan amount were approved.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs, vitamins, medicines and feeds.

loans.name: Rofel

texts.en:
Rofel is 31 years old and is married with two children. His wife is an LGU (Local Government Unit) worker. Rofel is into a furniture making business as the source of his income. He is patiently making cabinets, chairs, tables and beds to sell. He offers them on a cash basis and also on an installment mode of payment to acquire more customers. 

He is now asking for a loan to further improve his output. He is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy woods, varnish, paints and hammers to use in his furniture business. Someday, he would like to keep improving his output so that customers will always patronize his work, thus increasing his earnings.

loans.use: to buy woods, varnish, paints and hammer to use in his furniture business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and has two children. Both have finished their education. She was thankful for her business that supplemented her spouse's income in order to provide their daily allowances when she was still sending them to school. Now, she still operates her business to earn income. 

She is borrowing a loan of P7,000 to invest in her business. She will buy more used bottles, old newspapers and plastics to sell. She hopes this loan will be granted to her and she promises to pay it back on time. In the future, Elizabeth would like to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more used bottles, old newspapers and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Noreen Same's Group

texts.en:
Noreen Same is a 31-year-old married woman with four daughters. All of her daughters are young and getting an education from the nearby school.

Her husband is involved in garment business. He purchases ready-made garments and sells to customers. Noreen herself has a boutique business where she displays her sewed dresses and sells to clients at a profit.
 
Noreen’s brother-in-law also lives with her family.  He drives a rickshaw of his own to generate income. He has been in this profession for the past 5 years. He is an honest person and has good driving skills.
 
Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law’s business. With the loan, he will purchase a compressed natural gas (CNG) kit and do some repair work on his rickshaw so he can drive it for longer hours and increase his income.  Noreen is hopeful about the positive financial growth of her brother-in-law’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a compressed natural gas kit and repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 60 years old and a widow who manages a hog fattening business. She does this activity to pay expenses for her everyday living. Despite her old age, she scrapes by just to have food to eat every day. People know how she works, and she is very eager to earn a higher income.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,000 pesos. It will be used to buy feed and vitamins so the hogs will grow more quickly and be disposed of at better prices. This way, she will make more profit and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
