Through her hog fattening business, Merlita, age 27, can send her children to school to finish their education and become professionals someday. She strongly believes that education acquired by her children will lead them out of scarcity.

This causes Merlita to do all that she can to care for her business. In addition to her concern about her business, she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy fruits to sell, such as bananas and vegetables. She hopes that the loan will be a great help in diminishing the financial constraints they are experiencing.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as bananas and vegetables.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.en:
Erminia is 59 years old and a very productive woman. She operates a hog fattening business to earn income for her family. She is dreaming of a better living someday, so she patiently works hard in her business.

She is borrowing a loan of P15,000 to invest in her business. She will buy two more hogs, feeds and vitamins. She hopes this loan will be approved and she promises to pay on time. She is hoping for financial stability that she will achieve someday.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 47 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Romero, su esposo desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Efraín y Mía a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Ella se siente muy feliz, pues acaba de tener su última hija, que tiene 2 años de nacida, a pesar de su edad siente que es la luz que ilumina su camino. Por ello trabaja con mucho ahínco para salir adelante, su principal actividad es la venta de jugos en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ya tiene 7 años dedicándose a ello, es conocida entre sus vecinos, además porque en épocas escolares, vende útiles de escritorio a los padres de familia, para el comienzo de la escuela. Pero la actividad que más le gusta es el tejido de chalinas variadas y muy coloridas, las cuales vende en un centro comercial muy conocido y visitado por turistas de todo el mundo. Tiene tiempo para todo y en especial para su esposo que llega después de 15 días a la casa, donde pasan un momento en familia, ya que trabaja en una mina, durante los demás días del mes. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Lucila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de frutas para preparar sus jugos, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará una computadora para apoyar a su hijo en el estudio.
texts.en:
Lucila is 47 years old and a hardworking woman. She lives with Romero, her husband of 25 years. They have 4 children, but only live with 2 of them, Efraín and Mía. They are raising them in their own home, located in the community of Chilca. She feels very happy because she just had her youngest daughter, who is 2 years old. Despite her age, she is the light that guides her way. She works very hard to get ahead and her main activity is selling juice in an area she set up in her home. She has been doing this for 7 years and is well known to her neighbors. She also school supplies to parents during the school year. The activity that she likes the most is knitting shawls in different styles and colors. She sells them in a well known commercial area visited by tourists from around the world. She has time for everything, especially for her husband who comes home every two weeks to be with his family. He works in a mine the rest of the month. She belongs to 'La Florida" communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP. She feels that she has progressed, since she has received help to get ahead in her business. She promises to make her payments on time. She also likes to work in her association because they are supportive and responsible people. 

If Lucila receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying fruit to make her juices. If there is enough money, she will buy a computer to help her son in his studies.

loans.use: to buy fruit and a computer for her son.

loans.name: C 20009 Duteraninkunga N01 Group

texts.en:
Annonciatha is 35 years old and is widowed with seven children between 6 and 15 years old.  She sells rice. Annonciatha is a leader of this group, which is called "DUTERANINKUNGA N01 C20009" in the local language. This is her 5th year in this business.  She works from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. each day, except on the weekend. Annonciatha currently employs four people to help her. 

Annonciatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business buy purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate a large quantities of rice to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, un joven padre de familia de 30 años, es natural de Chupaca, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa de su madre. Tiene experiencia como músico desde hace 6 años, toca el bajo y es guitarrista, conforma parte de una banda musical donde tocan varios géneros musicales desde lo típico folclórico hasta lo más moderno en rock y cumbia. Los contratos que recibe  dentro de su grupo es semanal por lo que siempre tiene trabajo, incluso hay ocasiones que cobran por hora, el gran sueño de William es tener su propio grupo musical y crear canciones propias, lo que sabe de música lo aprendió  por unas amistades que le enseñaron a tocar sin embargo desea tener conocimientos más profundos de música de todo tipo, pues como él dice “a los clientes le gusta escuchar de todo”. El otro negocio que tienen es la venta de animales  en la feria ganadera de su zona aprovechando que desde su niñez sus padres le enseñaron este oficio para lo cual  tiene proyectos de incrementar su capital de trabajo y su ganado. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cristo Rey” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. William de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias ovejas para su negocio. Además del pago para arreglar su instrumento musical.
texts.en: William is a 30 year old husband and father from Chupaca. He lives with his wife and son in his mother's house. He has six years experience as a musician. He plays the bass guitar and is part of a band that plays different types of music, from folk music to more modern rock and cumbia. The contracts he gets with his group are weekly and always has work. There are times that he is paid hourly. William's big dream is to have his own musical group and write his own songs. What he knows about music he learned from friends who taught him to play. He also has deeper knowledge about all types of music. As he says "customers like to hear everything". His other business is selling animals at the livestock fair in his area. Since childhood, his parents taught him this trade and he has projects to increase his working capital and his livestock. He belongs to the “Cristo Rey” communal bank and this is his second loan with MFP. He feels that he has progressed because he is getting help to get ahead in his business. That is why he promises to make his payments on time. He also likes working with his association because they are responsible and supportive people. If William receives your support, he will invest the money he has asked for in buying various sheep for his business. He will also pay to repair his musical instrument.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is married. He has 5 children who all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output, and he plans to build a house if he gets the balance from the profits.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for labor support.

loans.name: Phenias

texts.en:
Phenias is 40 years old and is married with eight children. He sells various goods such as: tableware, pans, children's clothes, dishes etc and he has 10 years of experience in this business.

Phenias has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tableware, pans, children's clothes, dishes etc to sell. With the profit from the loan, Phenias will save for his future, to pay medical insurance for his family and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more tableware, pans, children's clothes, dishes etc to sell.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence has five children who are between three months and sixteen years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for nine years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and  seeds and hire additional labor so as to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.Prudence is a name given for both women and men, it's not for women only.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and seeds and hire additional labor.

loans.name: Amna Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Amna Bibi is a 41-year-old, married woman. By this relationship she has two children, one son and one daughter. Her son has experience in computer hardware and financially contributes to the family from his earnings. Her daughter helps Amna in managing the household.

Amna's husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw while Amna herself operates a dairy business. Her work is home-based. For this purpose, she has kept a buffalo at her home from which she gets milk and sells it to her community clients. Her nephew also helps her in her business.  

Amna has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her dairy business. She will use the loan amount to buy another buffalo. This will not only increase the milk productivity of her business but also prove beneficial for increasing her earnings too. 

She is very confident about the further growth of her dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo holding his son.

Islam is a 23-year-old young woman, she is a mother with one son and one daughter.  Her husband is employed, but he earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Islam is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom furniture for her children. Taking this loan will offer to Islam's children comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in the house.

loans.use: To purchase bedroom furniture for the children

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Rana is a 25-year-old woman, she is a mother with two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is employed with a low salary that is not enough to cover all the family's life costs.

Rana is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of installing new windows to the house. This will improve the family's house condition and offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install new windows in the house

loans.name: Radiatou

texts.fr: Madame  Radiatou a l’âge  de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et  évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Elle pratique la vente de produits cosmétiques et parallèlement  elle fait de la pâtisserie.  Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce sous l’influence de sa maman  à qui elle avait l’habitude de  donner  un coup de mains durant les weekends  lorsqu’elle n’allait  pas à l’école. Elle  éprouve beaucoup de plaisir pour son activité lorsqu’elle dispose d’un grand stock de marchandises  et que la clientèle puisse faire  son  choix sur une large gamme de produits divers. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEc et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour acheter des produits cosmétiques qui seront destinés   a augmenter son stock de marchandises. Toutes les dépenses du foyer sont prises en charge par son mari  et par conséquent l’augmentation de ses bénéfices par le biais de ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre son capital de roulement pour son activité de commerce et de  satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Madame  Radiatou is 45. She is married and works as a merchant. She sells cosmetics and also bakes. She decided to go into business because of her mother's influence; she used to help her mother out on the weekends when she was not in school. Radiatou really enjoys her work because she has a lot of merchandise and her customers are able to select from a wide variety. She is a member of one of one of the branches of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs. This loan will be used to buy cosmetics to increase her stock. Radiatou's husband covers all of the household expenses; so the increase in her income that this loan will bring about will allow her to have more working capital for her business and cover her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: C 20006 Abadahemukirana Group

texts.en:
Consolee is 40 years old and is married with six children between 7 and 20 years old. She sells rice. Consolee is a leader of this group which is called "ABADAHEMUKIRANA C20006" in the local language.  In the photo, she's the one who is in the red T-shirt. This is her 12th year in this business and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. except on the weekend. Consolee currently employs five people to help her.

Consolee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by purchasing more fertilizer to cultivate larger quantities of rice to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 55 years old and she still sells plastic wares to the people in her village. She is married and has five children. Only one of her children still attends school and needs her support. 

Natividad is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more plastic ware to sell such as basins, water jugs, and cabinets. Her loan will help improve her sales and increase her profits too. Natividad's dream is to increase her income to make her family live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and is married with three children. She runs a retail business where she sells plastic wares to the people in her village. 

Anita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy plastic ware to sell such as mats, basins and hangers. She would like to increase her sales but she needs additional capital to buy more products to sell. In the future, she would like to keep improving the services she renders to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en: Waseem is a 24-year-old single man. He is the oldest among his six brothers and sisters. Waseem is a business administration student and, at the same time, he works as a salesman for a women's outfit store. He has applied for this loan to pay for his semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 22-year-old single guy. He is one of eight siblings in his family. His mother is a housewife, and his father owns a pastry and snacks shop. 

Abdallah was not able to register at a university, but his eagerness to learn and get a university degree has pushed him to submit himself to a college to get a diploma first, and then continue to get a bachelor's degree in Managerial Information Systems. 

He has applied for this educational loan to pay for his semester's fees, so he can in the future continue and get his bachelor degree as he is planning.

loans.use: to pay for his semester's fees

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person, so she asked her oldest son to take her place in the photo as he is the one she took the loan for. 

Yasmeen is a 43-year-old housewife. She has four children; her eldest, Sultan, has recently turned 21 years old. He is a university student who is studying about monuments in order to work in the field if possible after graduation. He has asked his mother to help him in paying for the semester's fees, so she has applied for this loan to do so.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester at university

loans.name: Ampar Grace Group

texts.en:
Sarpiah is married and has there children. All of her children are still at school. She has been selling pop ice and noodles since 2009. Her business is running smoothly. Together with her husband, who works in a traditional market selling rice, they can provide the needs of the family. 

Now she plans to use her part of loan to add more supplies in her store and start selling daily basic needs such as eggs, sugar, and water. She hopes in the future she can expand her retail store and provide a better education for her children.

Other group members will use their part of the loan to sell clothes and snacks.

loans.use: to pay for eggs, sugar and water to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single guy. He has five brothers and sisters. Mohammad is a marketing student at one of the Jordanian universities. He has applied for this loan to pay for his current semester.

loans.use: to pay for his current semester.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 28-year-old single man. He is an accountant at a private college. Rajab got his job after getting his diploma certificate in accounting. Now he has registered in a private university to continue and get a bachelor degree in accounting to improve his educational level and, therefore, get a higher salary. He has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees, since Rajab is now the one responsible for his family after his father passed away.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 44-year-old housewife who has two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a bus driver. Because of their limited income, Amal has decided to apply for this loan to help her daughter Mays pay for her semester fees. Mays is a 21-year-old single lady. She is a second year accounting student who wants to work in the field after her graduation. 

Amal is a conservative person, so she asked her daughter, Mays, to take her place in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single guy. He is the oldest among his two brothers and sister. Ahmad is a hardworking person who chose to study and work at the same time. He got a job at an internet café that fits with his university schedule. He is a managerial finance student who wants to graduate as soon as possible to work in the banking field. Ahmad has applied for this loan in order to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 33 years old and married with two children. Together with her spouse, she works to generate income to sustain her family. Marivic's husband offers a motorcycle transport service, and she sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. Together, they earn about 8,000 PHP each month.

Marivic is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to buy cabbage, squash, bananas, and mangoes to sell. She hopes to keep providing friendly service and affordable prices to her customers so that she will earn good profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, squash, bananas, and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 55 years old and a very hardworking and determined woman. She works buying and selling vegetables as well as selling bibingkang malagkit, a native delicacy, in her village. Herminia works to increase her family's income and she is full of confidence that she will soon achieve a better standard of living. 

Herminia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy gluten, sugar, and milk to make malagkit, and vegetables to sell. She hopes to save for the betterment of her family and believes that her profits will provide a good, high quality life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en: Sadam is a university student in his third year now majoring in Physical and Gymnastic Education. He is a 21-year-old single guy. He is one of eight brothers and sisters in his family. Because of his big family, Sadam tends to depend on himself when it comes to financial matters. For that, he has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf, 23 years old and a single guy, is the oldest among six brothers in the family.

Ashraf is a hard-working guy who chose to work and study at the same time. He works as a security guard for a building. At the same time he goes to a college to study Computer Information Systems. 

Ashraf hopes that after graduation he will be able to find a job in his field in a good company, but now he has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Suhaib

texts.en:
Suhaib is 21 years old and a single guy. He is the third oldest brother among six brothers and two sisters. 

Having a big family is a huge responsibility for his parents which leads Suhaib to work and study at the same time to be able to cover his expenses and reduce the pressure on his family. Suhaib works in a ladies' accessories store. He has managed to fit in his work shift with his university schedule, and he is now in his second year majoring in accounting. He is hoping that he can work in the field after he graduates and help his family financially.

Suhaib has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
Ghaith is 24 years old and a single guy. He has five brothers and sisters.

Ghaith is a university student who is majoring in economics, and he has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees. 

After graduation Ghaith would love to work in the  field of economics.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is 20 years old and a single guy. He has three brothers and three sisters.

Saleem is a university student who is majoring in Computer Information Systems. He has applied for a loan to pay his semester fees so he can graduate as soon as possible and start being a proactive person in the society.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a conservative person, so she asked her husband Odai to take her place in the photo.

Asmaa is 24 years old and a housewife. Her husband works in an air shipping company and he encouraged Asmaa to continue with her studies at the university. Asmaa is now studying to become a school teacher, and she has applied for this loan in order to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is 27 years old and a single guy who works in a clearance company. At the same time he has registered to get a Bachelor's degree in English Literature.

Bassem is now in his second year, and he hopes that he can continue to get a Master's degree and work on assisting and teaching at the university in the future. Now he has applied for this loan to pay for his semester fees to be able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Huwaida

texts.en:
Huwaida is 23 years old and a single lady. She is the youngest among her three brothers and sister.

Huwaida is a university student studying to be a school teacher. Because her parents have retired due to their age, the family has no income now except for her working brothers who are trying to support her while she finishes her studies, but Huwaida wants to help so she decided to apply for this loan in order to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana, 19 years old, is a single girl and the youngest among her two sisters and one brother.

Rana has enrolled in the university to study accounting. She chose this major for its wide field that will allow her to work with numbers in any place she wants. She has applied for this loan to pay for her current semester to be able to continue and get her Bachelor's degree and apply it in the field.

loans.use: to pay for her current semester

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is 20 years old and single. She has one sister and two brothers and she is the oldest among them. Bayan is a university student who has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees. In the future, Bayan hopes to get a Masters and a PHD degree at the same time she is working in the field.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan, a 22-year-old single man, is a marketing student at one of the Jordanian universities. He still has a few subjects to take so he can graduate.
 
After school he goes to work at a workshop as a maintenance technician, and that allows him to make some money during the month. 

Now Marwan has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees so he can graduate as soon as possible and start working in the marketing field in a respectable company.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 19-year-old single woman. She is one of the seven children in the family.
 
Iman is majoring in foreign languages, studying French and English at one of the Jordanian governmental universities. 

She has applied for this loan in order to pay for her semester fees to get her bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham is 22 years old and single. She has five brothers and sisters. Reham is a university student majoring in General Translation. She hopes that after graduation she will work in her field. Today Reham has applied for a loan in order to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Suhaib

texts.en:
Suhaib, a 20-year-old single man, is in his third year studying accounting at the university.

He hopes that after graduation he will find a suitable job that will allow him to improve his accounting skills and get more certificates in accounting.

Suhaib has applied for this loan in order to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is 23 years old and single. She has one sister and four brothers. Her father is a taxi driver, and with what he makes daily it will be a challenge to be able to support the whole family, especially now that they reached the university level. So Alaa who is a student at one of the Jordanian universities majoring in Computer Sciences, took a job at the same university as a secretary to be able to help in paying for her college fees. Now Alaa has applied for a loan to pay for her semester fees and help her family with part of the money.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Sewar

texts.en:
Sewar is a 21-year-old single woman. She has four brothers and sisters.

Sewar is in her last semester majoring in finance and banking. She has applied for this loan to be able to pay for her semester fees and graduate.

loans.use: pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Ahid

texts.en: Ahid, 20 years old and single, is one of six daughters in the family. They have only one brother. Her parents had to work to be able to support the whole family. Now that they have two daughters in college, the family’s expenses have gotten higher. One of the daughters is Ahid who is in her second year majoring in Accounting. To help her family, Ahid has applied for this loan to pay for her and her sister’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her and her sister’s semester fees

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda, a 21-year-old single woman, has a sister and two brothers. Their father works as a truck driver.

Huda is a university student, studying to be a pharmacist. She hopes that after getting her bachelor's degree she can continue to get a master's degree and work at the same time.

Huda has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year- old single man. He is one of three brothers in the family. They have one sister.

Mohammad is a university student majoring in graphic design. At the same time he works at one of the malls to cover his expenses and pay for his college fees. 

Due to some urgent matters, he was not able to pay for his current semester, so he applied for this loan to pay his semester fees so he can graduate as soon as possible and work in the designing field.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 21-year-old single lady. She is the oldest of five sisters and a brother. After her father retired from the military, he started working for a company to be able to support his family and make sure that all of his daughters and his son complete their studies and education. 

Yasmeen is the first to enter university. She is now in her third year, majoring in Financing and Banking and hoping to work in the banking field after graduation. She also wants to set a good example for her sisters, so she is trying her best to graduate early and find a job. She plans to later register to get an MBA. Now she has applied for this loan to pay for her current semester to be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her current semester fees

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is the eldest of two sisters and one brother. He is a 27-year-old single man who lives with his family in Madaba.

Laith goes to one of Jordan's universities to study managerial sciences. He also works in freelancing jobs to make money while he goes to the university.

This is his first time applying for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 26 years old, is a single guy who lives with his parents and brothers. 

Ahmad is a university student majoring in Marketing. At the same time, he works at a sweets shop to be able to help in paying for his university fees. Now he has applied for this loan in order to pay for his current semester since he faced a shortage in the amount he has saved for it.

loans.use: to pay for his current semester

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 36-year-old single woman. She got a degree in nursing and started working in the field at one of the hospitals.

Linda wants to improve her position in the department. In order to do so, she has to get a higher degree, so she registered in the university to get a bachelor's degree and she is now in her fourth year. 

She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees so she can graduate and apply for a higher position.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 25-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is married and doesn't have any children. He studied only in secondary school and dropped out looking for income sources to help him stay alive. He started his business long ago on a movable wheelbarrow usually containing a tomato basket and one other basket of potatoes. He kept on this way for a long time and then developed a business to be opened in a small shop on the street where he now sells his vegetables instead of moving on a wheelbarrow. He took a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase enough vegetables to meet the demands of his clientele, which has expanded. This loan will allow him to purchase all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, etc and to build a good relationship with his clientele by serving their needs. In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business and improve his capital, as this will help in generating more income. He is also saving to buy a small truck, which he will use to bring his vegetables from the vegetable market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, etc to sell

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 23-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He’s doing the best he can to satisfy their demands and live as he should. 

He has been working as a constructor specializing in wall foliage since 2007 and waiting for the perfect time to grow in this field as much as he can. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new construction tools for his business such as wall foliage papers. 

In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage products shop.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools for his business such as wall foliage papers.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a 20-year-old married man who doesn`t have children. He and his wife live together in Ibb, Yemen. He has been operating a construction materials shop for the past three years. He is energetic and hardworking. He has spent a great deal of time improving and developing his business, to ensure that his customers are happy with his services. He works with almost all of the builders in his region. The high quality of his work has helped him gain customers' loyalty and trust.

Abdu applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to continue improving his business. He will use the loan to buy special updated construction materials such as cements, taps, light bulbs, ropes, etc for his business. He works hard to provide his family with the best living and he hopes he can continue to provide excellent service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy special updated building materials such as cements, taps, light bulbs and ropes

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 27-year-old, Lebanese single man. He lives on his own yet he intends to have a family and children. For this reason, he has decided to establish his own freelance business in order to reach his goals. He has been providing legal documentation services and has many customers visiting him to smooth the preparation of their official documents. 

Today, Amer is looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a photocopy machine and equip his office with the necessary supplies. This Kiva loan will improve his work and allow him to serve more clients. In the future, he plans to enlarge his office and better develop his work.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopy machine and equip his office with the necessary supplies.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 21-year-old man who hopes to make progress in the next few years. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. His story began because he’s always liked to work and selling chickens is profitable and not too complicated. He worked in KSA in the same field until he was able to collect a small amount of capital. Then he traveled to his home. He works every day and does not have any difficulties. He thinks of increasing his profit, so he is requesting a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy chickens for his business. His most important dream is to have a spacious locale to expand his business with other products. Thus his customers will feel more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his business.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 27 years old, he is a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been a grocer for three years. He has a small business on the outskirts of the new market of Sana`a. He started his business after his father's death. 

He needs this youth loan 100,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock merchandise like soft drinks, biscuits, mineral water, etc. He hopes to keep having more loans since with his earnings, he hopes to improve his home and have a better quality of life. His dream is to expand his business further.

loans.use: to stock merchandise like soft drinks, biscuits, mineral water, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 42 years of age and has three children who all attend school. Her only source of income is her hog raising business. She wants to develop this in order to achieve a higher income. 

For this reason, she is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs. 

In the near future, Pacita would like to acquire a higher income and be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover heavy life costs. Ali has been working as a furniture painter since 2002. He has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he has the intention to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his painting tools and develop his business. In that way, he will be able to earn superior income and enhance his life. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to renew his painting tools and develop his business

loans.name: Wajdy

texts.en:
Wajdy is a 27-year-old man and the father of two children whom he loves very much. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has been operating an electrical workshop for 14 years. He has employed two workers who assist him in his business and offer services to customers.

Wajdy is an orphan who grew up with his uncle and learned from him the work of electricity. He provides services for a living and is proud of the good work being carried out. 

Now he has the idea of being able to make some finishes on his house so that he can improve his quality of life. He knows that seeing his house much more beautiful will make him feel much more motivated in a better environment with his children. It is for this reason that he is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy electrical spare parts for his business in order to fix different cars of his clients.

He hopes his family can confide in him and help him to improve as a person.

Wajdy dreams of investing in a much larger business in order to improve his living conditions and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts for his business in order to fix different cars of his clients.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two working siblings. He’s the one taking care of his family with the help of his two siblings. 

Ibrahim has owned a coffee shop since 2009 in his town. People meet at his place to enjoy their time with friends, have a coffee and a hubble-bubble (hookah) as well. 

Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added products for his shop such as charcoal, coffee and many others. This will surely increase his sales and allow him to attract added customers. 

In the future, he plans to open a snack shop just next to his coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase added products for his cafe such as charcoal, coffee and many others.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer and she runs a business selling vegetables. The couple helps each other in order to bring their living situation out of poverty. 

Leticia is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to buy beans, pechay (bok choy), cabbage, squash, carrots, and other vegetables to sell. She will improve her business with her loan and wants to reach financial stability soon. Leticia hopes to improve her income to achieve her dream of being content with her way of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, pechay, cabbage, squash and carrots to sell

loans.name: Lucine

texts.en:
Lucine is a 27-year-old Lebanese single woman. She’s living with her parents and one working sibling. She’s the one taking care of the family and trying her best to cover all their needs. 

Lucine started to work as a beautician from her home in 2007. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and stylish beauty designs. 

Today, she’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new cosmetic products such as nail polish, cotton, polish remover and many other items. This will increase her sales by 30%. 

In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetic products such as nail polish, cotton, polish remover and many other items

loans.name: Cherli

texts.es:
Cherli, de 37 años, es una mujer muy activa, siempre está buscando alguna actividad que realizar para así poder generar ingresos para la educación de sus tres hijos, con quienes vive junto a su pareja en casa de su madre. Cherli tiene un trabajo que consiste en la compra y venta de joyas de plata y oro, además de la compra y venta de ropa y venta de abarrotes en general. Ella envía dinero a la ciudad de Lima, de ahí le envían los productos que ella se encarga de vender en la ciudad entre sus amigas y vecinas. Tiene un promedio de nueve años trabajando y lo realiza sola, asimismo tiene una muy buena cartera de clientes. Desde hace solo seis meses inicio su trabajo con la venta de abarrotes y le está yendo muy bien con su inversión.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener tiempo para estar realizando otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que a veces las personas se demoran en pagar, pero siempre tiene clientes y lo bueno es que como ya tiene años en el negocio sabe a quien dar y a quien no. A Cherli le gustaría mas adelante poner una tienda da platería y oro en la ciudad. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, comprará mas joyas de plata ya que quiere tener a la moda a sus clientes, además comprará algunos abarrotes para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Cherli, 37 years old, is a very active woman, always looking for something to do to be able to generate income for the education of her 3 children. She lives with them and her husband in her mother's house.

Cherli's business consists of buying and selling silver and gold jewelry, plus clothing and groceries in general. She sends money to the city of Lima and from there, they send products which she attempts to sell in her city among friends and neighbors. Cherli has been working for some 9 years on her own, and she has built up a very good customer list. Some 6 months ago she began selling groceries and the new investment is going well.

Cherli likes the work very much since it leaves her time for other activities. What she doesn't like is that at times, people delay paying. But she always has customers and the good thing is that since she now has years devoted to the business, she knows who to give credit to and who not to. Cherli would like, later on, to establish a silver and gold jewelry store in the city.

This will be her 5th loan through MFP. Cherli is very content to know that she will have financial aid, since she will feel more secure advancing her business. Once again, she is committed to complying with her schedule of payments, as she has with previous loans. In addition, Cherli is very content to belong to her communal bank, since everyone is very responsible and supportive.

With the 1,800 new sols requested, Cherli will purchase more silver jewelry, because she wants to keep her customers in style, and she will buy some groceries to continue in that business.

loans.use: buy more silver jewelry and other products to resupply her store.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a very active person who is married with six children. She and her husband work hard to help their children achieve their desires in life. Thelma's husband helps her in their sari-sari (variety) business which also has video games. Through her business, Thelma is able to send her children to school. She wants them all to finish because she believes that this is instrumental to improving their standard of living. 

Thelma is requesting a 15,000 PHP  loan to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, vinegar, cooking oil and to maintain her video game machines. Hopefully, her loan will contribute to her higher income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and maintain her video game machines

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a patient mother. She has eight children but lives separately from them. Along with her husband, Adelina runs a business hauling junk and recyclable materials that they resell for a profit. 

Adelina is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to expand her business and buy more used bottles, old newspapers, and boxes to resell. She prays for good health to keep operating her business and save funds to use when emergencies arise.

loans.use: to buy bottles, newspapers, and boxes to re-sell

loans.name: Clesi

texts.es:
Clesi, de 52 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es viuda hace varios años, tiene cinco hijos a quienes crió y educo hasta hacerlos personas de bien en la sociedad, ahora ella vive en su casa propia a lado de una de sus hijas con quien comparte muchas cosas. El trabajo de Clesi, consiste en la venta de golosinas, inter diario se dirige al mercado en busca de dulces, galletas, chupetines y demás golosinas buscados en su negocio, tiene una pequeña vitrina en su casa en donde exhibe y ofrece sus diversos dulces que sirven para endulzar el día como nos dice ella, lleva 5 años en éste negocio el cual empezó a hacerlo debido a que su esposo falleció y debía tener algún ingreso con el cual solventar algunos gastos que tenia, durante el tiempo se estableció económicamente y ahora está empezando recién a hacer crecer su negocio.
Le gusta su trabajo por que es muy relajante para ella, ya que puede conversar con las personas y ya que sus clientes preferidos son los niños, puede jugar y divertirse con ellos, espera seguir trabajando ya que desea seguir juntando su dinero para mas adelante poner una golosinaría mas grande. Este será el crédito número cuatro con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará golosinas y mas productos que ofrecerá a sus clientes, además comenzará a vender bebidas ya que vio que será una fuente extra de ingresos para su economía.
texts.en:
Clesi is 52 years old. She is a good and kind woman and has been a widow for several years. She has five children that she raised and educated to make them good members of society. Now she lives in her own home next to one of her daughters with whom she shares a lot. Clesi's work is selling candies. Every day she goes to the market seeking sweets, cookies, lollipops and other candies sought after in her business. She has a small storefront in her house where she shows and offers the different sweets to sweeten the day, as she tells us. She has had this business for 5 years. She started it because her husband passed away and she had to have some income to pay her expenses. Over time she got financially established and now she is starting to grow her business.   

She likes her work because it is very relaxing for her, since she can talk to people. Her favorite customers are the children, because she can play and have fun with them. She hopes to keep working because she wants to get the money together to open a bigger candy store. This will be her fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, because she will feel safe going ahead in her business. She is committed once more to making her payments on time as she did with the previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank since all of the members are kind and supportive. With the 1000 soles she has asked for, she will buy candies and more products to offer her customers. She will also begin to sell beverages, since she saw that this will be a source of extra income for her.

loans.use: to buy candies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma was born in 1970 in Sivrihisar. She is married with three children. Her husband is a civil servant and two of her children study at university. The other one goes to high school. She began her business life when her children's educational expenses increased. She wasn't happy with only her husband working, because she wanted to contribute to her family’s budget, so she stepped into the business world. Firstly, she started to work in a textile factory. At the beginning of her job in the textile factory, she did delivery and shift work. She found the job hard, but she didn't give up because if she quit her job, she wouldn't be able to support her children's education, and she was encouraged by this thought. 

After that, she got the best job opportunity of her life. She partnered with the owner of a tailor shop with the help of someone close to her. She dedicated herself to this job. Later, her partner opened a new shop, so Fatma became the owner of the original shop. 

Her biggest dream is to be an expert at her job and she wants to make her own shop a fashion house. She doesn't want her husband's contribution, because she wants to do everything by herself. She financed the rest of the shop with the Maya loan, as well as repairing the machines in the shop. She appreciates the Maya loan through Kiva and has shown that she has developed her business and is determined to continue to do so in the future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Fatma Hanim 1970 Sivrihisar doğumlu. Evli ve 3 çocuk annesi . Eşi memur ve çocuklarının ikisi ünv.öğrencisi birisi lise. Fatma Hanım ,iş hayatına çocuklarının eğitim masrafları vb arttığında başlamış.Memur olarak çalışmakta olan eşinin tek maaşla evi geçindirmesine gönlü razı olmayan Fatma Hanım, hem kendi ayaklarının üzerinde durup hem de aile bütçesine katkıda bulunmak isteyince iş hayatına adım atmış. Bir giyim fabrikasında dikiş nakış üzerine çalışmaya başlamış ilk dönem bu işi öğrenene kadar getir götür işlerine bakmış ,vardiyalı çalışmış,bu konuda çok zorluklar çektiğini dile getiriyor fakat vazgeçmemiş çünkü çocuklarının eğitimi için çalışmak zorunda olmak onu hep daha çok kamçılamış. Fabrikanın zor çalışma şartlarına rağmen işini bırakmamış taki önüne hayatının fırsatı olarak tanımladığı terzi dükkanı çıkana kadar bir yakının aracılığı ile tanıştığı bir terzi dükkanına ortak olarak başlayan Fatma Hanım, daha da severek özenle işine sarılmış yanındaki ortağının bir başka yerde terzi dükkanı açıp gitmesiyle şu anda çalıştırdığı dükkan tamamen kendisine kalmış. Fatma Hanımın, en büyük hayali bu konuda çok iyi olmak ve dükkanını ileride bir moda evi durumuna getirebilmek bunu yaparken de eşinden maddi destek almak istemiyor çünkü eşi aile geçimini sağlıyor ve Fatma Hanım işi konusunda herşeyi kendi başarmak istiyor. Maya’dan kredi kullanarak dükkanının bir kirasını ödedi ve makinalarının bakımını yaptırabildi. Maya’ya minnettar olduğunu dile getiren Fatma Hanım ,azmiyle ve işine bağlılığıyla başarıya ulaşabileceğini şimdiden gösteriyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Razia Begum's Group

texts.en:
Razia begum is a 32-year-old married woman with four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are getting their education from a nearby school. Razia is a very dedicated woman who works very hard in her business so that her children can get a good education and have a bright future. For the past seven years, Razia has operated a decorative embroidery business. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which attract customers. Razia loves her work and does it with full dedication. Her clients are very satisfied with her products and give her regular orders every month. 

Razia is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy materials such as beads, colored thread, and cloth for her decorative embroidery business. She will purchase larger quantities of these supplies to enable her to complete orders on time and increase her profit. Razia is hopeful that her loan will improve her business. In this photo, Razia begum is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy materials and cloth for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Mukhtar's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a married woman and a mother of three children who all are young and stay at home. She herself is involved in a sewing & embroidery business. She does this work after finishing her household work. She does the business to cover the household expenses with her husband. 

Her husband has an animal-sales business. He buys young animals from the animal markets and sells them to butchers after raising them. He is very experienced in his business. He has good knowledge about animal breeds and people trust him for his work. He receives good number of orders and earns good profit on each sale. 

Mukhtar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats for reselling. Mukhtar is hopeful that her husband will make good profit from his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy goats for animals sales business

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı was born in 1982. She is a married woman with three kids. Despite her young age, she manages to take good care of her family and kids. She got to know about Maya when she was selling cosmetics products from her house in order to support and contribute to her family. Her husband was working at Pinar, a Turkish water company. However as time passed, Asli and her husband decided to start their own business. They decided that whatever they did, Aslı would be able to work and to take care of her children at the same time. They decided to do what they knew best so they opened a distributing agency for a water company. This way her husband would keep doing his job and Asli would answer customers' phone calls. Aslı also could have her children with her at the store. 

Aslı and her husband had financial difficulties, but they managed to open their distributing agency. With the loan from Maya, they are able to develop their business further. They are managing to reach more customers. Their dream is to buy other distribution outlets in Eskisehir so that their agency will be one of the main distributing agencies in the area. With this loan, Asli will buy 5 gallon bottled drinking water in bulk for their water distribution store. This business they've started means a lot to them since it is a way to improve their family's living standards.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Aslı Hanım, 1982 Eskişehir doğumlu evli ve 3 çocuk annesi.Genç yaşına rağmen 3 çocuğunun sorumluluğunu en iyi şekilde yerine getirmeye çalışıyor.  Hem bir anne hem de bir iş kadını .  Aslı Hanım, Maya ile tanıştığında evinden bir makyaj firmasının ürünlerinin satışını yapıyordu ve ailesine bu konuda destek olmaya çalışıyordu eşi ise pınar su bayisinde işçi olarak çalışmaktaydı.  İlerleyen dönemlerde kendi işlerini kurmak istediler ve bu konuda fikir üretmeye başlayınca şöyle bir karar aldılar öyle bir iş yapmalıydılar ki Aslı Hanım, çocuklarının da yanında olmalıydı ve aynı zamanda işinin başında olmalıydı.  Sonunda yapıcakları işe karar verdiler eşinin en iyi yaptığı ve bildiği iş içme suyu dağıtım işiydi ve bir bayi açabilirlerse hem eşi işini yapıcak hemde Aslı Hanım, bu iş yerinin başında duracak işleri yürütecekti.  Maddi konuda çok sıkıntılar çekmelerine karşı yinede bayilik başvurusu aldılar ve eşi dağıtıma bakarken aslı hanımda dükkanın başında durup telefonla müşterilerin adreslerin siparişleri aldı ve bu süreçte çocukları da dükkanda yanındaydı.  Maya'dan çektikleri kredi ile damacana sayısını çoğalttılar ve böylelikle daha fazla insana ulaşabilecekler şimdi en büyük hayalleri Eskişehirde ki birçok bölgenin bayiliğini alıp ana bayilerden biri olabilmek.Eşiyle beraber başladıkları bu iş onların ve çocuklarının geleceği insanlara su satarak hizmet verdikleri bu iş aslında onların can suyu oldu.

loans.use: to buy 5 gallon bottled drinking water in bulk for her outlet store

loans.name: Rezeq

texts.en:
Rezeq is photographed next to his taxi. He is a 41-year-old man, married and a father with five sons. He has been a taxi driver for 7 years. It has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover all life's needs.

Rezeq is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses needed to make necessary repairs to the taxi such as: changing the tires, changing the floor mats, changing the engine. This will increase the taxi's efficiency and enable Rezeq to work extra hours and take more internal and external requests which will increase the family income.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to the taxi

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is photographed inside her house. She wants to completely finish it.

Fatema is a 47-year-old woman, a mother with three sons and two daughters. She is a worker who gets low salary, but not enough to cover the family's costs as her work is the only source of income for the family.

Fatema is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of completing the house such as: installing windows and doors, installing tiles, and painting. This will improve the house's condition and create better living conditions for Fatema and her family .

loans.use: To complete her house with windows and doors, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia has the dream of opening her own sari-sari (variety) store but because of financial constraint she pursues her green-grocery business. She is currently selling vegetables in the "barrio" and every Thursday and Sunday she goes to market to sell her wares. This is her opportunity to achieve higher profit from her sales. 



To gain more income, she needs a greater variety of products to sell. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy ginger, leafy vegetables, beans and cabbage as additional goods. She hopes for the improvement of her business in order for her to build her own store. That would be less work for her and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ginger, leafy vegetables, beans and cabbage

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali 35 years old and is married with one son and one daughter. He is photographed here in his restaurant. For the past year, he has operated this restaurant, which has been successful and profitable. 

Ali is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing necessary supplies such as chairs, tables, spoons, and plates. This will improve the image of the restaurant and increase sales which will improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, spoons, and plates for his restaurant

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 57 and works selling fresh vegetables and fruit. She has been operating her business for over one year and she sells in the barrio as well as the market to improve her income.

Beatriz is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase fruits such as bananas and cucumber, and vegetables such as cabbage and potatoes. Her loan will help improve her everyday income. Beatriz hopes to expand her business and have a better way of living to save funds for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan is 37-year-old married woman and by this relationship she has seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a worker in a factory on monthly wage. He financially contributes to the family from his earnings.  Her husband has a motor workshop where he repairs different vehicles like motorbikes and cars. He is very talented man. His clients are very satisfied with his work. 

Sharifan herself is a very dedicated woman. She operates a decoration pieces sales business. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. Her collection of decorative mirrors and vases are her main items. She has good demand for her decoration pieces among her customers. She earns good profit on each piece. 

Sharifan has been doing this work for over 10 years and has got a good reputation among her customers for her good range of items.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her decoration pieces sales business. She will invest the loan in buying of decoration pieces (mirrors and vases) in larger quantity for reselling. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sharifan.

loans.use: To buy decoration pieces for resale

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 38 years old, married and has two children. Both attend school. His spouse provides manicure services to the people in their neighborhood. Ricky plants and harvests rice to sell. He had been in his farming business for almost 20 years. 

He would like to improve his farming output but he has insufficient funds so he is borrowing a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

Ricky prays for good health to continuously provide sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
A determined man named Romeo is expressing his gratefulness for having a supportive wife and two children. They own a farming business and it serves as the family's primary source of income. They plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been in this business for almost 20 years.

As of now, he has insufficient funds for his farming business so he is borrowing a loan of P35,000 to buy 6 bags of UREA (fertilizer) and 5 bags of rice seeds for use in farming. 

With his hard work and the help of this loan, Romeo knows that someday he will attain success and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of UREA (fertilizer) and 5 bags of rice seeds for use in farming

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and has nine children. Only two attend school. With her spouse, Dante, she cultivates a hectare plot of land. They plant and harvest rice in it and sell the rice to traders. With their income from the business, they are very happy to be able to sustain their needs for education, bills and meals for the family. Lolita would like to increase their crop production so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming.

In the future, Lolita hopes to achieve plentiful crops every harvest and save funds to use when emergency arises and invest part of the profit in a hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 28 and 15 years. Two of them go to school. 

Mary runs a mixed food store business and a grinding machine for flour, and she has been in the business for five years. She has one employee. Mary heard about Finance South Sudan through fellow clients, the promotion done in the market by the loan officers, and a radio advert.

She is taking a loan of 2,500 to purchase more items like cassava flour, maize, grain, sorghum, and many others. In addition to this business, Mary has a grinding machine for flour as another source of income.

In five years' time, Mary has hopes for building her house.

Her major challenges include low income rate and day to day changes in prices of goods in the whole sale market.

Mary says that she appreciates Finance South Sudan’s support in South Sudan, which has helped many women to start up a business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like, cassava flour, maize, grain, sorghum and many others.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Borrower Narantsetseg is a 47-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a small apartment. She has operated a food stall business for 16 years at a local indoor market. Her husband is an on-call plumbing manager, and his business is very popular during the spring, summer and autumn. 

Now it’s the beginning of spring season; therefore, he needs some tools for operating his business besides his wife’s income. Their daughter studies at the local university, so the family needs study fees. 

Thus, Narantsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase necessary plumbing tools for her spouse’s business.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha de 42 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Américo, su esposo desde hace  20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Salir adelante es muy difícil, sobre todo por sus hijos a quienes cuida con mucho esmero. Pero cada 15 días viaja a la capital del país donde compra lencería para mujeres y losetas para piso, su forma de trabajo es vender la mercadería 2 veces al mes a la ciudad de Satipo (selva central peruana), donde tiene muchos clientes, pues en esa zona no existen muchas tiendas de lencería fina y losetas, ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a ello, y es muy conocida. “Mis hijos están creciendo y quiero que estudien en una universidad reconocida”, afirma. Por ello trabaja muy duro, pero no se siente sola porque recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista en una mina reconocida. Ella tiene que coincidir cada 20 días en su casa pues, su esposo llega para pasar tiempo en familia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Mirtha de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 42, is a modest woman.  She lives with Américo, her husband of 20 years.  Together they have three children whom she raises in their own house, located in the town of Chilca.

Getting ahead is very hard, especially because of her children, for whom she cares with great effort.  But every two weeks she goes to the capital where she buys women's lingerie and floor tiles.  She sells the merchandise twice a month in the city of Satipo (in the central jungle area of Peru), where she has a lot of customers, because in that area there are not many fine lingerie or floor tile stores.  She has been doing this work for six years already and she is very well known.

"My children are growing up and I want them to study in a recognized university," she says.  This is why she works very hard.  But she does not feel alone because she receives the support of her husband, who works as an electrician in a well-known mine.  She has to go home every 20 days because her husband arrives to spend time with the family.

She belongs to the La Florida solidarity group and this is her tenth loan with MFP, where she feels empowered because she gets the help to get ahead with her business.  This is why she promises to be punctual in making her payments.  In addition, she likes to work in her bank because they are responsible and supportive people.

If she receives her support, Mirtha will invest the requesting money in buying merchandise to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles as well as lingerie.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали житель города Вахдат. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Курбонали сорок лет работает по профессии, преподавателем. Также он занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Kurbonali is a resident of the village Vahdat. He is 60 years old and married. He has two children. Kurbonali has worked as a teacher for 40 years. He is also engaged in crop cultivation. He has been engaged in this type of activity for ten years. He takes a loan for sowing wheat and to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for his tractor.

loans.name: Akramsho

texts.ru: Акрамшо проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Образование у него высшее. По специальности он инженер. Акрамшо занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа овец и коз.
texts.en: Akramsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 26 years old, married and has a higher education.  He is an engineer.  Akramsho is involved in breeding small livestock.  He is requesting this loan to buy sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old. She is married and has four children.

She earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the village. She is requesting PHP 4,000 to purchase "camote" tops, bananas, squash and string beans to sell.  She has been doing this tirelessly for over four years. She believes that this is the secret of attaining her objective: to send all her children to school and experience a better living standard.

loans.use: to purchase "camote" tops, bananas, squash and string beans

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали житель района Дангара. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Он более восьми лет занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmadali is a resident of the Dangara district.  He is 38 years old, married and has six children.  His children attend a school.  Mahmadali has been involved in animal husbandry for over eight years.  He is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is photographed inside her house with her husband and her newborn son. She is a 37-year-old woman, a mother with three sons and one daughter. She has a project of making home-made pastries, which is a profitable project.

Hanadi is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of resolving moisture problems and rot at her home which threats her family with catching diseases. This will improve the family's house conditions and offer them healthy conditions to live in.

loans.use: To solve moisture problems and rot at their home

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 63-year-old man, married and a father with five sons. 

For the past 30 years, Khaled has been selling wrist watches and accessories, which has been a profitable project.

Khaled is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of making some changes and improvements to his store such as: installing new shelves and cupboards, painting, and installing lights and ceiling decoration. This will create a more modern image for the store and attract new customers, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To improve the store's condition.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a farmer living in the Philippines. He is raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He is married and has three children attending school. He would like to improve his farming practices and his output but he needs additional capital. He is now borrowing a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help ensure proper growth of crops in his rice field. 

Someday, with good profits from the business, he will attain a successful life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y cordial, es separada del padre de su hija de 7 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su papá, mamà, su hija y sus 4 hermanos a los que quiere mucho, habitando la casa de sus padres. Las a actividad que realiza Blanca, es la venta de ropa y sandalias  de damas y caballeros,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos cada mes a la capital, donde realiza sus compras buscando los mejores precios y modelos ò en ocasiones le envía su tía quien vive en esa ciudad, para luego venderlos entre sus amistades de manera personal. También vende productos de belleza que comprar por catálogos, donde tiene bastante pedidos de sus amistades y familiares, realizando estos negocios desde hace 03 años realizándola ella sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija, y los considera rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Antes tenía problemas económicos, pues se separó del padre de su hija,  y no recibía pensión para los gastos. Pero desde que empezó a trabajar a tenido muchas satisfacciones gracias a su negocio, por ello desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer, abriendo una boutique en la casa de sus padres. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse a gusto con banco comunal pues considera a  su grupo ser unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y sandalias de diversos modelos y tallas, traídos de la capital,  buscando los precios más bajos y así tener mayores ganancias, ya que cuenta con pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Blanca, aged 30, as a diligent and hard-working woman, who is also friendly and cordial.  She is separated from the father of her seven-year-old daughter.  She lives in her parents' house with her dad, mom, daughter and her four brothers, whom she loves very much.  

The work that Blanca does is selling women's and men's clothing and sandals.  To do this, she makes periodical trips each month to the capital, which is where she makes her purchases, looking for the best prices and fashions, or on occasion she sends her aunt who lives in the city.  She then sells her products personally to her friends.  She also sells beauty products, which she purchase from catalogs when she has sufficient orders from family and friends.  She has been working with these businesses for the last three years, and does it on her own.  She enjoys her busines, because it generates income to meet household expenses and education costs for her daughter.  She considers it to be successful because of the good profits that it provides.

She had financial problems earlier on, as when she separated from her daughter's father, she didn't receive any allowance from him for expenses.  But since then, she has had great satisfaction thanks to her business.  This is why she wants to expand her business and make it grow, opening a boutique in her parents' home.

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP institution, which is why she hopes for your participation, so that she can make her plans become real.  She also really enjoys the communal bank, as she considers her group to be united and supportive of each other.

With the requested amount of 1,500 new soles, she will invest in purchasing different fashions and sizes of clothing and sandals, as she orders to fill.  She will bring the items from the capital, where she will search out the lowest prices and in this way have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 51 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, es conviviente co su pareja y tiene dos hijos de 25 y 12 años, vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. EL trabajo de Pilar consiste en la crianza de aves de corral, tiene dos galpones en un distrito muy cerca de la ciudad, es ahí a donde va todos los días con la compañía de su pareja a verificar y alimentar a sus animales, su promedio de producción es de 1500 pollos cada 45 días que el tiempo de promedio de días que dura la crianza desde que son pollos bebes hasta que salen al mercado. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 5 años aproximadamente y es algo que aprendió poco a poco. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le da tiempo de hacer algunas cosas mas, ya que solo utiliza la mitad del día para estar en los galpones y el resto del día está en su casa a lado de sus hijos y ayudándolos en las cosas que necesitan, cada día se convence mas que el trabajo que tiene es muy buen, ya que tiene muchos clientes fijos quienes están en espera de que salga la producción del mes para comprar sus pollos que son grandes, gordos y saludables, ahora se prepara para ampliar con un galpón mas y está convencida que en base a arduo trabajo logrará seguir creciendo. Este será el crédito número 13 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración par continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado ella se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.
