Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará pollos bebes para seguir con su crianza, además refaccionará algunas cosas de los galpones en donde cría a sus aves.
texts.en: Pilar is 51 years old. She is a good, kind and enterprising woman. She lives with her spouse and has two children, aged 25 and 12. She lives in her own house and works hard to offer a better quality of life to her family. Pilar's work is raising poultry. She has two sheds very close to the city and she goes there every day with her spouse to check on and feed her animals. Her average production is 1,500 chickens every 45 days, which is the average time needed to raise the chicks to be ready for market. She has dome this job for approximately 5 years and it is something she learned little by little. She likes her work because it gives her time to do more things. She only uses half the day to be in her sheds and the rest of the day she is at home with her children helping them with anything they need. Every day she is more convinced that the work she does is good, since she has a lot of regular customers who wait for her monthly production because her chickens are big, plump and healthy. Now she is preparing to have one more shed and she is convinced that with her hard work she will keep growing. This will be her 13th loan with MFP. She hopes for your cooperation to continue with her goals. She is also committed to making her payments on time as with the previous loans. She also wants to keep working with the members of the communal bank because they are all kind and supportive. With the 4000 soles she has asked for, she will buy chicks to raise. She will also replace some things in the sheds where she raises her birds.

loans.use: to buy chicks and materials to raise chickens.

loans.name: Naseem Begum's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Begum is a 39-year-old married woman. By this relationship she has three children, one daughter and two sons.  All of her children are enrolled in school and getting an education. 

Naseem Begum is a seamstress. Her work is home-based. She receives regular orders every month from her clients and earns an income. She does this work to supplement the income for her family.  

Her husband is a government employee and receives a monthly wage. 

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will invest the loan amount in buying a new sewing machine because her old machine doesn’t produce quality work. 

Naseem is hopeful that with a new machine, she will be able to fulfill her orders on time and earn good revenue from this.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela, age 50, is a very helpful and determined mother. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She earns an income from her hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years now. She is thankful for her business. 

Graciela  would like to keep developing her business so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs. 

Some day, with good profits and good financial management, she will create a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina's goal in life is to provide a better quality of life for her family, especially for her children. She and her husband are working together to achieve this goal.

Cristina is 43 years of age, married, and has two children attending school. She runs a clothing business where she sells a variety of clothes in the market. Her husband is a farmer and her partner for growth in her business through advice and moral support.

With her desire to send her children to school through college, Cristina works hard to earn extra income and sustain her children's needs in school. She would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional items of clothing to sell in the market. She hopes to earn a higher income and further support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional items of clothing to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lourinda

texts.en:
Lourinda happily lives in Alimannao with her spouse and three children. To earn a living, the couple sells junk and other recyclable materials for profits. This way, they can provide for their children and other needs of the family. 

Lourinda is in need of additional capital so she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more used bottles, plastics and empty cans to resell.

Some day, she hopes to continuously finance the education of her children. She would be very happy and proud if this dream came true.

loans.use: to buy more used bottles, plastics and empty cans to resell.

loans.name: Mushkinaz

texts.en:
Mushkinaz is 46 years old married woman and she has four children ages 15 to 21.
The scope of her employment is agriculture, in which she has been engaged for 8 years. 
She sells the meat at a bazaar; her family helps her to do it. She wants to expand her business in future.
Mushkinaz's daughter is getting married and she wants to obtain 1,000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy furniture for her. Being a very responsible woman, she hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her daughter.

loans.name: Alam

texts.en: Alam is 45 years-old, married and has 4 children. He is an 16 years experienced taxi driver. Now he wants to start the fruit and vegetable trading business. Alam wants to obtain for 1000 AZN so he will able to become true his plans. The additional income will help him to support his family better.

loans.use: To buy the inventory for his fruit and vegetable trading business

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is motivated to work hard by her favorite saying: try and fail, but don’t fail to try. Jovita is 58 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Her husband is a farmer working in the Philippines. Jovita runs a sari-sari (variety) store business.

With her desire to earn a higher income and have a better quality of life, Jovita started another business, which is cooking glutinous rice to sell in the market.  She is happy that she has kept this business going for 23 years now.

Jovita wants to earn more income to save for her family in case of future emergencies. She wishes that she could sell more glutinous rice in the market, but she doesn’t have enough capital to make her wish a reality. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy glutinous rice, sugar, wrappers, and some other ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, sugar, wrappers, and some other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, age 44, is borrowing PHP 6,000 from ASKI as additional working capital for her piggery business. It will be used to purchase feed, vitamins, and medicine. This will be a big help in improving her income, as well as her family's living conditions. 

In addition to raising pigs, Norma buys and sells bananas. She patiently does such activities for her family. Norma aspires to save enough money for the education of her four children and to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.ru: Nizami jenat, emu 54 goda, u nego 3 detey vozrastov ot 14 do 19. On vmeste s jenoy zanimaetsa selskoxozaystvennim delom. Oni prodayut sherst, moloko i masyo, ix klienti eto mestnie jiteli. Nizami nadeetsa rasshirit svoy biznes, chtobi ego deti smogli polucit uchebu. On stroit  dom dla semyi i iza finansovix trudnostey emu prishlos priostonovit stroyku i oni jivut v dome bez udobstv.  Segodna emu nujni 800 AZN dla zaversheniya postroyki doma. Nizami nadeetsa na ponimanie i zarane vsem blagodoren.
texts.en: Nizami is married, he is 54 years old and he has 3 children ages from 14 to 19.  Together with his wife he is engaged in farming. They sell leather, milk and meat to local customers. Nizami is hoping to expand his business to be able to pay for his children's education. He's also building a house for the family and because of financial difficulties he had to pause the construction and the family is living in a house without basic amenities. Nizami is asking for 800AZN loan to be able to complete his house.  Nizami is hoping for your understanding, support and is thankful to lenders.

loans.use: To finish the building of house.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a wise person who will not stop trying until she succeeds. She started her business selling glassware at the age of 32. Now, she is 52 and has already been running her business for 20 years. Her inspiration in running her business for such a long time is her family. She wants to raise her family out of poverty.

Rosa is married and blessed with six children. Her husband is also a vendor in the market. When she started her business she experienced some failures, but she did not lose hope. Now, Rosa is happy to report that her business is doing well. Through the income she earns, she is able to provide her children allowances in school.

Rosa wants to maintain and gain a higher income from her business, which is why she decided to take a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy kitchen utensils to sell in the market. She hopes to receive the loan and maintain the business as her source of income.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to sell in the market.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old, married, and has two children who attend college. She is a business-minded person. When she got married, Evelyn started a hog raising business where she earned enough income to allow her to start another business of buying and selling rice and corn. She has been in this business for five years and earns a higher income. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy rice and corn to sell in her village.  She wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn..

loans.name: Kristelita

texts.en:
Kristelita owns and manages a small store in front of her house at Libag Sur. She is 44 years old and married and has one child. 

Kristelita patiently attends to her customers' needs. She is thankful for all her customers who patronize her store. She would like to keep improving her services and her sales, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy sugar, biscuits, soft drinks and noodles to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, biscuits, soft drinks and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita works hard to support her family. She is married and blessed with four children. She is in the business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Jovita has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more goods such as eggplant, onions, garlic, tomatoes and squash. Hopefully, she would save enough funds to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as eggplant, onions, garlic, tomatoes and squash

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is a 32-year-old divorced man, a worker with a low salary, but not enough to cover all his costs.

To prepare himself  to get married again, Bahaa is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of finishing his house, such as: installing tiles, painting, and installing lights. This will offer Bahaa suitable and comfortable house conditions as he is preparing to get married soon and move to live in it.

Bahaa is photographed next to his house.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa est couturière de profession, elle est mariée et âgée de 37 ans et s’active depuis 3 ans. Son atelier se trouve à proximité du guichet. Awa possède 5 machines et emploie 2 tailleurs dans son atelier. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500000 F CFA  pour pouvoir acheter une autre machine et des tissus à la mode afin de confectionner des ensembles, les exposer pour les revendre. Puisque l’atelier est un peu large, elle profite de l’occasion pour y vendre aussi des friperies (habits comme chaussures).
Les bénéfices de son activité sont réservés à améliorer les conditions d’études de ses enfants car l’avenir des parents c’est les enfants et  c’ est aussi un investissement à long terme.
texts.en:
Awa is a professional seamstress. She is married, 37 years old, and has been working for three years. Her studio is close to the bank branch. Awa has five machines and employs two tailors in her studio. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to be able to buy another machine and fabrics that are in style in order to create outfits and display them to resell them. Since the studio is a bit big, she is taking advantage of the situation and also selling used clothes and shoes there.
The earnings from her business are set aside to improve the conditions of her children's education, because the parents' future is their children, and it's also a long term investment.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years of age and engaged in a hog fattening business. This is her source of income as well as her way to help her husband in providing their food. In her situation, she also aspires for a comfortable life soon.

In this matter, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to maintain her business. She is hoping that through the loan, she will be able to increase her sales as she disposes of her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to maintain her business

loans.name: Razia Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Razia Sultana is a 40-year-old married woman and she has four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education at a nearby school. Razia and her husband know the value of education, which is why they work hard so that their children can get a good education and make their futures secure and bright.

Razia owns and operates a clothing and embroidery business. Her work is home-based. She receives orders from her community clients and earns income for the family. Her husband runs a grocery store where he serves people from the community. His good business sense and fair dealing always get priority among his customers for purchasing. 

Razia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. She will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine takes a lot of time to sew a single dress and does not produce quality work. Razia is hopeful that with this investment she can expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Zubaida Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida bibi is a 48-year-old talented lady. She owns & operates a sewing & embroidery business at her home which she does to financially contribute to the family. She is very good in her work. She keeps herself up-to-date about the latest trends and fashions which helps her understand her customers' choices and demand. 

Her husband has a business selling animals. He buys young animals and sells them after raising them for a good profit. He has been in this business for many years. He has obtained a good reputation among his clients. His good knowledge about the animal breeds helps attract many other customers towards him and allows him to get good orders.  

Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy young goats & buffalo to sell. Zubaida is hopeful about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy goats & buffalo for animal sales business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 33-year-old who dreams of a comfortable life someday. Her dream leads her to strive harder in earning an income. She has a sari-sari (variety) store that provides enough income to cover her family's daily expenses. She has been in this business for almost ten years and she is aiming for a better income from it. 

To make this possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries for her store such as spices, soft drinks, candies, and washing soap. She strongly believes that with this loan, she will be able to develop her business and eventually obtain her dream.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries for her store such as spices, soft drinks, candies, and washing soap.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita, aged 42, works hard to provide sustenance for her family. She had been selling fruit and vegetables in her village for almost four years now. She only generates a minimal income from her business. This encouraged her to ask for a loan of P7,000  to buy cucumber, eggplant, bitter melon and root crops. She hopes to improve her sales to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cucumber, eggplant, bitter melon and root crops

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando es una persona que a pesar de las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y seguir adelante junto con su familia. Desde muy temprana edad inició a trabajar en la actividad de la agricultura, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y desde muy temprana edad se la enseño. Orlando actualmente se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Orlando desde que empezó a trabajar inició ahorrando sus ingresos, y poco a poco ahorrando logró completar el dinero que requería para comprar una finca y poder sembrar sus cultivos en ella, sin embargo, conflictos de violencia en su región hicieron que abandonara su finca y sus cultivos y buscara un nuevo lugar donde hospedarse con su familia. Fue así como le regalaron un curso donde le enseñaron a cosechar frutas y cítricos y decidió montar un cultivo con estos productos. Con el ánimo de sacar su nuevo cultivo adelante Orlando busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materias primas que necesita para su cultivo.

Orlando espera que de esta manera pueda salir adelante con su cultivo y pueda generar ingresos con los que su familia pueda gozar de una buena calidad de vida. Además, Orlando sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria y sueña con dejarles una finca en buenas condiciones con la que puedan garantizar una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Orlando is a person who, in spite of life’s adversities, has had the strength to overcome them and get ahead with his family.  He started working in agriculture at a very young age.  His father devoted himself to this business activity, and his father taught him when Orlando was very young. 

Orlando is now married and has three children.  He has always wanted to provide them with a good education.  Ever since he started working Orlando began saving his income.  By saving little by little he managed to get the money he needed to buy a farm and be able to grow crops on it.    However, violent conflicts in his region made him abandon the farm and his crops.  

This caused him to look for a new place to stay with his family.  This was how he was given a course where that taught him to grow fruits and citrus.  He decided to start growing these products.  With the intention of getting ahead with his crops, Orlando seeks a loan.  The loan will provide him with the opportunity to buy supplies and raw materials that he needs for his crops.

Orlando hopes that this way he will be able to get ahead with his crops.  He hopes that he will be able to generate income so that his family is able to enjoy a better quality of life.  Also, Orlando dreams that his children will be able to access a university education.  He dreams of leaving them a farm that is in good condition, which will be able to ensure financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials that he needs for his crops.

loans.name: Ricardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre humilde y trabajador que se dedicaba a la actividad del reciclaje para subsistir, lo cual hizo por muchos años. A través de un programa con una fundación descubrió que tenía un gran espíritu emprendedor y decidió aprovechar el hecho de que su vivienda está ubicada en una esquina de la principal vía de su barrio. Ha sido muy pro-activo y ha luchado fuertemente para establecerse en su negocio. Se vio envuelto en una circunstancia adversa de que el gobierno quería cerrar su negocio con el motivo de que estaba invadiendo el espacio público, sin embargo, luego de recoger más de 100 firmas y recibir asesoría legal logró defender su caso y ahora tiene los respectivos permisos. Ricardo busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras locativas a su negocio, las cuales le prometió a la entidad del gobierno que vigila y regula el uso del espacio público. 

Ricardo espera seguir con su negocio adelante y hacerlo prosperar en su sector. Además, Ricardo tiene el sueño de ser un profesional e ir a la universidad, pagando sus estudios con los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a humble, hard-working man who worked for many years in recycling. Through a programme run by a foundation, he discovered that he has a great entrepreneurial spirit. He decided to take advantage of the fact that his home is located on the corner of the main street in his neighbourhood. He has been very proactive and has worked hard to establish his business. He had to confront a difficult situation; the government wanted to close his business for invading public space. However, after collecting over 100 signatures and getting legal advice, he was able to defend himself and he now has the necessary permissions. Ricardo hopes that a loan will provide him with the ability to buy construction materials to make some improvements to his business. He promised the government body that regulates the use of public space that he would make these improvements.
Ricardo hopes to keep improving his business and to prosper. His dream is to be a professional and to go to university, paying his tuition with the income from his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to make improvements to his business.

loans.name: Sandra Catalina

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven emprendedora que a la corta edad de 19 años ya ha montado su propio negocio y trabaja fuertemente para sacarlo adelante. Sandra se dedica a la confección de su propia línea de prendas de vestir las cuales comercializa en su municipio y en otros municipios cercanos. Actualmente estudia diseño de modas y con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado su propia marca de prendas de vestir adelante. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha podido captar un gran número de clientes, los que le garantizan unos grandes niveles de ventas. Su negocio lo montó hace 2 años y debido al poco capital con el que lo montó ha visto la necesidad de incrementar su capacidad de producción para responder a todos los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Es por esto que Sandra busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la confección como telas e hilos y poder aumentar la capacidad productiva de su negocio para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Sandra espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y siga saliendo adelante, de modo que pueda cumplir su sueño de tener su propio negocio que sea muy reconocido en el país y desde el cual pueda generar mucho empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young entrepreneur. At the young age of 19, she has already established her own business and she works very hard to maintain it. Sandra sews her own line of clothing, which she sells in her municipality and in other nearby municipalities. She is currently studying fashion design; with great hard work, she has made her own line successful. Thanks to the high quality of her products, she has been able to capture a large section of the market. These clients guarantee her a large level of sales. 
Sandra opened her business two years ago. She started off with a very small amount of working capital, so she has found it necessary to increase her production capacity in order to fill all of her clients' orders. For this reason, Sandra is requesting a loan. This loan will offer her the opportunity to buy the tools she needs, such as fabric and thread, and to increase her business' production capacity in order to fill all of her clients' orders.
Sandra hopes that her business will continue to grow and succeed thanks to this loan; and that she will be able to reach her dream of having her own business which is well-known throughout the country, and which will generate a great deal of employment for those who most need it.

loans.use: to buy supplies for dressmaking, such as fabric and thread, in order to increase production and fill orders.

loans.name: Dahlia Makmur Group

texts.en:
Derliana is married with four children. She is pictured wearing an orange T-shirt. She has been selling "Sembako" - "sembilan bahan pokok" (Indonesian terms for nine daily basic needs such as rice, oil, salt, sugar and milk) since 2010. She runs this business to have extra income to add to the income from her husband as a teacher to provide more nutrition for the children. Her business is running smoothly and she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more rice, eggs, oil, sugar and also snacks to sell. In the future she wants her business to grow so she can have more supplies in her store. She also hopes she can send all of her children to university. 

Other group members are using their part of the loan to sell cookies and to sell cell phone minute refills.

loans.use: to pay for more rice, eggs, oil, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Phok's main activity is crop husbandry. She grows rice, potatoes, beans, and a few types of vegetable on her own farm in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Phok is now 52 years old and has a common law relationship with her husband who works in the construction field. Together, this couple has been blessed with five children. Two of them are already married and live independently. 

With the amount she requested from HKL, she will pay for the process of cultivating potatoes on a three hectare plantation in a new cycle. This loan will enable Phok to sustain her business and make a stable living for her family. She plans to save some money to expand her farm land and achieve great farming productivity.

loans.use: to pay for the process of cultivating potatoes on a three hectare plantation in a new cycle.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is a 54-year-old woman, married with three daughters. She is an honest and hard-working woman. She is a widow and is raising her children alone.

Zamina has been reselling jewelry for the last seven years. She started her business with a tiny amount of money and with several loans from AqroInvest CU, expanding slowly. As she is raising her children on her own, it is hard for her to provide for them and she always needs support. Every morning Zamina leaves home and comes back late at night. The money which she makes is only enough for day-to-day spending and it's hard for her to save for the future. 

For this reason Zamina would like to take out a loan of 1800 AZN to purchase more jewelry in bulk and expand her business, increasing her profits and improve living conditions for her family. This will be her fourth loan and she has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry

loans.name: Denie

texts.en: Denie, age 36, is an entrepreneurial woman who is seriously aiming to move forward in life. She is determined to achieve all her objectives, such as experiencing a good quality of life. Her two children serve as her motivation in pursuing her retail business.  She wants to expand her business, but unfortunately she suffers from financial constraints. This is why she decided to request a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase biscuits, instant noodles, beverages, breads, and soft drinks. She is very sure that these products will allow her to earn higher profits and to offer a better future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, instant noodles, beverages, breads, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sana is a 37-year-old single woman. Her brother is a judge with a low salary, and so she sews clothes at home for customers which is a profitable project that helps her to support herself and cover her daily costs and needs.

Sana is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new sewing machine. This will help Sana to improve the quality of her work and satisfy her customers, increase sales and improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Karry Esmenia

texts.en:
Karry Esmenia is 34, married, and blessed with two children. She has a stall in the market where she sells a variety of meat. The products she offers are of great quality and affordable prices. This helps her acquire loyal customers.  And as time has passed, she has gained many customers. 

Karry Esmenia wants to expand her product line and provide her customers a larger variety of fresh meat. So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pork, chicken, and vegetables as additional goods to offer. With her loan and excellent service, she knows that someday she will provide her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, and vegetables as additional goods to offer.

loans.name: Maiquel

texts.es:
Maiquel, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y decidido con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es separado de la madre de su hija. Viven en casa de sus padres en compañía de su mamà, papá, y 5 hermanos a quienes apoya. La actividad que realiza Maiquel es el servicio de transporte, para eso cuenta con 3 mototaxi que  alquila a sus vecinos cobrando hasta 20 soles por día.  Empezó de muy joven hace más de 7 años alquilando un mototaxi, con las ganancias fue pagando las cuotas de ese vehiculo hasta que llego a ser de su propiedad, continuado con la compra de un segundo vehiculo, hasta tener 3 unidades. También estudio mecánica de motos, brindando mantenimiento a sus propios vehículos y en ocasiones a particulares.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, pues cuenta con ingresos diarios. Se decidió a empezar con éste negocio, pues necesitaba de un oficio para generarse ingresos y el deseo de apoyar con los estudios a sus hermanos menores, y brindarles las facilidades que él no tuvo.
Por tanto y viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea ampliarse y abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos de motos. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con sus negocios. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues los considera ser un grupo solidario y unido. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para sus vehículos como llantas, aceites y otros, para las 3 unidades, de esa manera mantener operativos sus vehículos y puedan seguir trabajando, generándoles más ingresos.
texts.en:
Maiquel, 33, is a hardworking, driven man who very much wants to get ahead.  He’s separated from his daughter’s mother.  They live in his parents’ house with his mother, father and five siblings he helps support.  Maiquel’s activity is providing transportation services and to do so he has three mototaxis that he leases to neighbors charging up to 20 soles per day.  He started very young over 7 years ago leasing a mototaxi and gradually used profits earned to pay off that vehicle until he owned it.  He then continued with the purchase of his second vehicle until owning three units.  He also studied auto mechanics so he’s able to service his own vehicle and sometimes those of individuals.

He believes that his business is quite profitable because it earns daily income.  He decided to start this business because he needed an occupation that would generate income and because he wanted to help with his younger siblings’ education and give them the opportunities he never had.

Therefore, seeing the good results he gets, he wants to expand and open a motorcycle spare parts shop.  This will be loan #5 with MFP and he feels grateful for the support of being able to rely on a line of credit to continue with his businesses.  He feels comfortable in his communal bank because he considers it to be a mutually supportive, united group.

He will uses the 1000 new soles requested to buy spare parts for his vehicles like tires, oil and others, for all three vehicles, so that they will be in operating conditions and be able to continue working generating more income for him.

loans.use: to buy tires and oil.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun is 27 years old and is responsible for three school-aged children between the ages of 6 to 10. The main business activities are focused on agriculture, including crops and livestock husbandry. She is a proud farmer and enjoys her daily work a lot, although it’s such hard work at the rice field, because she wants to achieve her dream of being a successful entrepreneur, uplifting her family out of poverty and ensuring a bright future for their three children. Soun’s spouse is helpful to her and involved in the same business as her. Together, they can make around USD 10 per day through the business.

Soun now would like to have these funds to pay for whole process of planning potatoes in the up-coming season. This loan will enable her make a stable business and further develop it towards a positive goal. In the future, Soun wants to save some money to renovate her house because it’s too old and is becoming less comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to pay for whole process of planning potatoes in the up-coming season.

loans.name: Prospero Astro

texts.en:
Good management, a degree in Computer Science, plus the desire to own a business are the keys to 37-year-old Prospero Astro's success. With the help of his wife, he established a computer shop in the village 11 years ago, and they work together for its improvement.

With the goal of further expansion of his enterprise, Prospero Astro is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional computers and accessories and to pay for maintenance. His desire is to provide for all of his family's needs, especially those of his children, both of whom are currently studying.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers and accessories and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46, married and has eight school-aged children. They live happily in their village, planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Due to high cost of food and school fees, Leonora engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and usually earns profits of P8,000 a month that she utilizes for their food and allowances for their children. 

She aims to improve her business and increase her income but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional amount of P34,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Penn

texts.en:
Penn is a 30-year-old married woman who has been residing in Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She earns a living in a fair way, dedicated to rice farming. She has been with this business for almost 20 years. She is a diligent farmer who pays careful attention to her crops. She balances the water in field, provides fertilizers and pesticides to ensure a good harvest. Penn has had to try to work harder to raise five children alone since she divorced her spouse. Two of her daughters now work for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city and share their incomes to help the family as well.

In addition to her normal income and using her second loan, Penn would like to start up a small retail business out of her home. She will buy the first stock of merchandise to make her new business run. It’ll be a great help for Penn to attain her dream. In the future, Penn wants to renovate her house and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to start up a retail business from her home.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Kao, 64, married with eight children, together with her husband, has spent her life dedicated to rice farming. She has been in this business since 2002. She cultivates and harvests her rice crops twice a year. Besides rice, she sometimes grows various kinds of vegetables, potatoes and beans based on the season and market demand. 

She is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to pay for the whole process of cultivating dry-season rice and watermelon. She hopes to raise more income through the investment and thereby improve her family’s living status. In the coming years, she wants to expand her farm and further establish the family-owned business.

loans.use: to pay for the whole process of cultivating dry-season rice and watermelon.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Orlando, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca.  Sus deseos de mantener la estabilidad familiar mantiene con muchas energías a Elena, quien se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, su trabajo consiste en criarlos en un corral que tiene, que por falta de espacio disponible en su casa, colocó en el patio de la casa de uno de sus familiares. Elena es una madre de familia muy dedicada a sus hijos,  razón por la cual ha decidió criar cerdos en la casa cercana a un familiar y de esa manera generar más ingresos para su familia, su deseo es poder tener una granja más grande que le permita obtener  un incremento para mejorar la satisfacción de las necesidades de sus hijos,  es por ello que sigue  en esta humilde ocupación. Ya tiene muchos años de experiencia en la crianza de donde según sus propias palabras, se siente agradecida. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Elena de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Elena, 42, is a hardworking woman living with her husband, Orlando, and their four children they care for in their own house located in Chilca.  Her wish to maintain family stability gives Elena much energy.  She raises pigs.  Her work consists in caring for them in a corral located in one of her family member’s yard because she did not have enough room at her house.

Elena is a mother who is devoted to her children which is why she decided to raise pigs at her relative’s nearby house to generate more income for her family.  Her wish is to have a larger farm that will allow her to obtain an increase to better meet her children’s needs; this is why she continues with this humble occupation.  She has many years of experience raising pigs which, in her own words, she feels grateful for.

She belongs to a group called “La Florida” and this is the ninth loan with MFP where she feels empowered because she obtains the help to make progress with her business.  Because of this she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  She enjoys working with her communal bank because the people are responsible and mutually supportive.  If Elena were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working mother who is engages in a hog-raising business to generate income. She is 38 years old and has two school-aged children. With her husband, she agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and becomes professionals in the future. Despite the hardships in farming, they have the determination to pursue their plan. 

Evelyn aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. She is asking for an additional capital of P34,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that the loan will help them to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a 49-year-old woman and aspires to have a prosper business as well as good living conditions.  With her business selling rice in the market, she is helping her children to finish school. The difficulties she has experienced in providing the necessities for her children make her desire even more to send them to school. She doesn’t want her children have the same lot as she has.  Consequently, she is striving to provide their school needs.


In this matter, Emelda is asking a loan of P15,000 to buy additional rice to sell in order to achieve higher sales. She hopes for great changes in their lifestyle and at her present business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza runs her "sari-sari" (variety) store within the village of Gud. She has been engaged to this kind of business for more than 10 years. She is happily married and has been blessed with three children who go to school.

Riza has been a client for three years and has good track record. She is really grateful for the unending financial support given to her by the lenders because she is able to improve her store. But due to the high cost of basic commodities and some outstanding loans to some of her customers, her capital for restocking her store is no longer enough. For this reason, she is asking for another loan amounting to P10,000 which will be used to buy merchandise. She is hoping that she can get the amount of loan she is requesting in order to earn more profit and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is 68 years old. She is from Baray, a rural district located in Kompong Tom province. She is married with five children, and they all have their own families and independent livelihoods. So has operating a hog raising business since 2000. She has obtained nice experience from it. She is good at looking after her pigs, fattening them, providing vitamins and medicines, and she doesn’t have any concerns involving this project at all. Her spouse provides his income for the family by collecting and selling firewood with his trailer pulled by buffaloes. 

So has requested a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a stock of firewood to sustain their business and make a stable living. Her future plan is to further develop her current businesses and upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of firewood to sustain the business and make a stable living.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola de 26 años convive con Juan Manuel con quien tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Chanchamayo. Paola es una madre joven pero muy trabajadora. Se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando café, plátanos y mango. Cuenta con 5 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas en producción y otras 2 que cultivará en este año.
“La venta de café es rentable, de mis parcelas cosecho 120 sacos de 60 kilos, me va muy bien”, comenta. 
Ella siembra en varias partes alejadas de su localidad. La calidad del café varía de acuerdo a la altura. En parte baja (alrededor de su hogar), los granos de café los vende a 40 céntimos; y en la parte alta (montañas) a 60 céntimos. Le conviene sembrar en las montañas pero también requiere de más cuidados y el traslado de sus productos desde esa zona, también implica inversión. Por suerte los compradores llegan hasta su comunidad para adquirir sus productos. Así ahorra en flete y personal operario. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse cómoda con personas amables y trabajadores que ahora forman parte de su banco comunal “Inkani”. Paola invertirá el dinero en el pago de los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de café y plátano de la maleza. Les pagará también por el apoyo en la cosecha de mango, que realizará en  el mes de marzo.
texts.en:
Paola, 26, lives with Juan Manuel and their two children who are 5 and 3 years old.  This entire family lives in a house of their own in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, Río Negro-Chanchamayo District.  Paola is a young but very hardworking mother.  She’s a farmer; she grows coffee, bananas and mangoes.  She has five parcels of farmland in production and another two that she’ll plant this year.  “Coffee sales are profitable.  I harvest 120, 60-kilo sacks from my parcels and do very well,” she comments.

She plants in several parcels at a distance from her location.  The quality of the coffee varies according to the altitude.  In the lower elevations (around her house) the coffee beans are sold for 40 céntimos and in the higher elevations (mountains) for 60 céntimos.  It’s advantageous to plant in the mountains but it also requires more care and product has to be transported from that zone which also implies extra cost.  Fortunately, buyers come to her community to acquire her products so she saves on shipping and labor costs.

This would be her first loan with MFP so she gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  She affirms that she feels comfortable with the kind, hardworking people who now form part of her “Inkani” communal bank.

Paola will use the money to pay day laborers who will clear weeds from her coffee and banana crops.  She will also pay them to help harvest the mangoes which will take place in March.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina manages a large farm of pigs in their village. She started her business with a small piggery house and three pigs. When she developed her expertise in the business, she expanded her business.

Faustina is 58 years of age, married and has 10 children. Her husband is a farmer planting rice in their fields. Through her income from the business, Faustina was able to provide her children's allowances in school and some are already finished with their education. Now Faustina has two children still in school who chose to go to college and are about to graduate.

With plenty of hogs, Faustina has a shortage of hog feed. Faustina is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes to get a loan again  to maintain the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Saiqa's Group

texts.en:
Saiqa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes a lot of time to sew a single dress.  

Saiqa is a married woman and she has three daughters. Her elder daughter reads in 10th standard, the next is in 5th standard while her youngest one is in 4th standard.  Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He provides transportation facilities to his  passengers and charges fares which he sets according to the route. His fares are very affordable for his passengers. 

Saiqa and her husband both are very hard-working persons. They are bringing up their daughters with great care and providing them better education so they gets good opportunities in life.  Saiqa is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio de 24 años está casado con Isabel, con quien tiene una hija: Selena de 2 años. Está joven familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo. Ignacio se dedica a la agricultura. De niño ya salía al campo con las herramientas para ayudar en el trabajo de sus padres.
Actualmente cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos, en ellos cultiva de café, cacao, plátanos y maíz. Pero el cultivo de cacao es lo que domina.
“Cada año cosecho 200 kilos de cacao, y lo vendo en mi mismo pueblo”, menciona.
El trabajo es muy cansado. Ignacio tiene que enfrentarse a las intensas lluvias que azoten a su comunidad y a sus cultivos en estos meses (enero, febrero y marzo), de otra manera no obtendría la satisfacción de ver venderse con éxito sus productos.
Recibe el apoyo incondicional de su esposa; pero cuando las labores son más absorbentes contrata personas extra para agilizar sus labores. 
Tiene muchos planes en mente. La superación es su meta, así le brindaría a su familia un calidad de vida mejor. Sería el primer crédito que Ignacio recibiría de MFP, por eso dice que será responsable pagando las cuotas mensuales. Se muestra emocionado de tener por compañeros de trabajo a familiares y amigos en su reciente banco comunal “Inkani”. Con el dinero podrá pagar al personal operario que contratará para la limpieza de sus sembríos, ya que la maleza impide el crecimiento normal de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Ignacio, age 24, is married to Isabel. They have one daughter, Selena, age 2. This young family lives in their own home in the Yavirironi community, Río Negro – Satipo district. Ignacio works in agriculture. As a child he would go out into the fields with his tools to help his parents with the work.
He currently has two parcels of land on which he cultivates coffee, cocoa, bananas and corn. Cocoa is his main crop.
"Every year I harvest 200 kilos of cocoa, and I sell it in my village", he says.
The work is very tiring. Ignacio has to deal with the intense rain that batter his community and his crops at this time of the year (January, February and March). Without this, he would not be able to sell his products successfully.
His wife also helps him with the work; but when it becomes busy, he hires people to help out.
Ignacio has many plans. His goal is to succeed, and to offer his family a better quality of life. This will be Ignacio's first loan with MFP. He promises to be responsible in paying his monthly quotas. He is excited to have his peers, family members, and friends working with him in the new Inkani communal bank. With this loan, he will be able to pay labourers to weed his land, since weeds impede the natural growth of his crops.

loans.use: to hire day labourers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda de 29 años, está casada con Walter, con quien tiene 3 hijos: Yadira de 10, Beker de 7 y Walter de 4 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Hace 12 años, el tiempo que se casó con Walter, empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Nilda es una madre joven pero muy trabajadora. Cultivando y  plátanos. Cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas en producción.
“La venta de café es rentable, de mis parcelas, el año pasado coseché 8 sacos de 60 kilos, este año tendré como 10 o 12 sacos”, comenta. 
Ella siembra en varias partes alejadas de su localidad. La calidad del café varía de acuerdo a la altura. En parte baja (alrededor de su hogar), los granos de café los vende a 40 céntimos; y en la parte alta (montañas) a 60 céntimos. Le conviene sembrar en las montañas pero también requiere de más cuidados y el traslado de sus productos desde esa zona, también implica inversión.
Por suerte los compradores llegan hasta su comunidad para adquirir sus productos. Así ahorra en flete y personal operario.  Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse cómoda con personas amables y trabajadores que ahora forman parte de su banco comunal “Inkani”. Con el dinero podrá pagar a los operarios que limpiarán sus cultivos de la mala yerba, que crece rápidamente entre el cafetal.
texts.en:
Nilda, 29, is married to Walter and they have three children: Yadira, 10, Beker, 7 and Walter, 4. They all live together in a house of their own in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, Río Negro District, Stipo Province.  Twelve years ago when she married Walter she started to work in agriculture.  Nilda is a young but very hardworking mother.  She grows coffee and bananas and has two parcels of farmland in production.  “Coffee sales are profitable.  Last year I harvested 8, 60-kilo, sacks of from my parcels and this year I’ll get 10 or 12 sacks,” she comments.

She farms in several locations at a distance from her location.  The quality of coffee varies according to altitude.  In the lower elevations (around her house) coffee beans sell for 40 céntimos and in the higher elevations (mountains) for 60 céntimos.  It’s advantageous to plant in the mountains but they also require more care and product must be transported from there which implies extra costs.  Fortunately, buyers come to her community to acquire her products so she saves on shipping and labor costs.

This would be her first loan with MFP so she gives her word that she’ll be punctual with her monthly payments.  She states that she feels comfortable with the kind and hardworking people who now form part of her “Inkani” communal bank.  She will use the money to pay day laborers who will clear her crops of bad weeds that grow quickly among the coffee plants.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Soeup

texts.en:
Soeup is 35 years old from Pouk District in Siem Reap Province. She is happily married with a small child attending school. She works as a local farmer as well as a pig raiser. She typically earns an average of $2.50 USD each day and tries hard to support the family.

Soeup wants a loan to purchase more piglets for raising. She expects the family income to increase through this investment. And with the remaining funds, she will buy some fishing materials for her spouse, who currently works as a local fisherman, to better the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets for raising

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal tiene 33 años. A los 20 años unió su vida a la de Edith, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 7 años. Esta familia es unida y cálida y vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Desde 1990 Anibal se dedica a la agricultura. Recuerda que de niño ya salía al campo con las herramientas para ayudar en el trabajo de sus padres.
Actualmente cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos, en ellos cultiva de café de buena calidad, ya que los pobladores de su localidad se preocupan por la producción de café orgánico.
“El año pasado coseché 15 sacos de café, este año cosecharé como 20 sacos”, menciona contento.
El trabajo es muy cansado. Anibal tiene que enfrentarse a las intensas lluvias que azoten a su comunidad y a sus cultivos en estos meses (enero, febrero y marzo), de otra manera no obtendría la satisfacción de ver venderse con éxito sus productos.
Recibe el apoyo incondicional de su pareja; pero cuando las labores son más absorbentes contrata personas extra para agilizar sus labores. 
Anibal cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos que aún no producen, por eso, uno de sus planes es sembrar más café. Sería el primer crédito que Anibal recibiría de MFP, por eso dice que será responsable pagando las cuotas mensuales. Se muestra emocionado de tener por compañeros de trabajo a familiares y amigos en su reciente banco comunal “Inkani”. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de  7000 plantitas de café para iniciar una siembra en 2 parcelas de terrenos. Cada plantita le cuesta 20 céntimos.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 33, joined his life to Edith when he was 20 years old; they have three children who are 12, 10 and 7 years old.  This family is united and loving and they live in a house of their own in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, Río Negro District, Satipo Province.  Aníbal has been a farmer since 1999.  He recalls that when he was a little boy he’d head out to the fields with his tools to help his parents with their work.

He currently has two parcels of farmland where he grows good quality coffee since residents in his location are concerned with organic coffee production.  “Last year I harvested 15 sacks and this year I will harvest about 20 sacks,” he mentions happily.  The work is very tiring.  Aníbal must face intense rain that hammers his community and the crops during these months (January, February and March).  Otherwise he’d not have the satisfaction of successfully selling his products.  His spouse gives him unconditional support but when the tasks are more intense he hires extra laborers to streamline the work.  Aníbal has two parcels of farmland that are still fallow so one of his plans is to plant more coffee.  

This would be Aníbal’s first loan from MFP so he says that he will be responsible with his monthly installment payments.  He’s excited about having family members and friends as coworkers in his recent “Inkani” communal bank.  He will use the loan money to buy 7000 coffee seedlings to start the plantation on the two parcels.  Each seedling costs 20 céntimos.

loans.use: to buy 7000 coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Jay-Ar

texts.en:
Coming from a poor family encourages Jay-Ar to work hard to have a better future. He is 25 years of age and is single. Jay-Ar has been engaged in hog raising for seven years. He wishes for the continued growth of the business and to earn profits. 

With his status in life, Jay-Ar is the one who provide his hogs feed through his income in farming. Sometimes he has difficulties in providing his hogs feed because of financial shortages. Jay-Ar needs to maintain the business to attain his wish. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for his hogs. Through the loan, he will maintain the growth of the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Keat

texts.en:
Keat, age 56, is a conscientious woman from Pouk District, Siem Reap Province, who is involved in bamboo basket making. She had a life partner in her husband, but, unfortunately, her spouse passed away and left her with three children. However, presently, all of them are employed and can earn their living independently.

For additional income, Keat is taking out her second loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Her daughter will be responsible for this new business because Keat is getting older now. In the future, she will save some money for the expansion and growth of her family-owned business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 39 años, convive con su pareja hace 18 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 17 y 6 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la ciudad de La Merced – Chanchamayo. Elizabeth es una mujer inteligente y activa. Se dedica a la venta de productos en su tienda instalada en su propio hogar. Todo lo que tiene actualmente es producto de su esfuerzo. Inició vendiendo ropa de casa en casa. Con los ahorros consiguió abrir un negocio más próspero. Actualmente expende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad; además ofrece licorería, medicinas, ropa y juguetes. “Vendo de todo, de acuerdo a las fechas, por ejemplo en marzo venderé útiles escolares para el inicio de clases”, comenta. Su trabajo es rentable. Todos los días invierte en la compra de mercadería, y recupera con éxito pudiendo ahorrar.
Por su parte, su esposo trabaja como psicólogo, en una institución educativa. Así sus ingresos son mayores y su calidad de vida.
Esta contenta con su trabajo, por eso continuará con la atención a sus clientes quienes le son fieles en las compras. Sería la primera vez que Elizabeth accedería a un crédito con MFP gracias a su ayuda, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. 
De adquirir el dinero podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, además de útiles escolares como: cuadernos, fólderes, lapiceros, etc. “Tengo que estar lista para la época escolar”, finaliza.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and has been living with her partner for 18 years.  They have two children, ages 17 and 6.  They all live in a home of their own in the city of La Merced – Chanchamayo.  Elizabeth is an intelligent and active woman.  She sells products in a store out of her home.  Everything she has now is the product of her efforts.  She began by selling clothing door to door and used her earnings to start a more successful business.  She currently sells groceries and primary needs products; she also sells liquor, medicine, clothing, and toys.  She says, “I sell many things, based on certain dates; for example I will sell school supplies in March when classes begin.”  Her work is profitable.  Every day she invests in merchandise and successfully makes sales, allowing her to save.

Her husband works as a psychologist in an educational institution.  Their income and quality of life is good.

She is happy about her work, so she continues attending to her customers, who are loyal with their purchases.  This will be Elizabeth’s first loan through MFP, thanks to your assistance.  This is why she is committed to making her monthly payments on time.

She will use the money toward her business and buy school supplies, such as notebooks, folders, pencils, etc.  “I need to be prepared for the school season,” she says.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Nos

texts.en:
Nos is a young mother of a small child, living in a village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a local rice cultivator and has a common-law relationship with her spouse who is engaged in the same business. He is helpful and manages most of work at the field. 

Nos would like to borrow some funds from Kiva, through HKL,to buy timbers and pay construction workers to renovate her present house. She wants to get it done soon.

loans.use: to buy timbers and pay construction workers to renovate her present house.

loans.name: Leanghom

texts.en:
Leanghom (in the photo), age 23, is single, lives with his mother, sister, and brother in a village outside Phnom Penh City. 

Leanghom is a garment worker. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle to get work. Currently, he commutes to work by riding a bicycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get work.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou is 52 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife who are his main priority. He owns a few pieces of land which are in very good condition for growing rice every year. With some of his spare time, he works in animal husbandry. He has a couple of cows on his farm. He is able to generate an income of USD 4.00 per day. 

This is the first loan that Bou has received from HKL. He will use it to buy a second-hand motorcycle to satisfy the family’s needs. He has not received previous loans from State banks but HKL gave him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to satisfy the family’s needs.

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en:
Chrep, age 34, is a farmer. Her husband, Vantha, age 36, is a soldier, and they live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. Two attend school and the other one is still too young. 

Chrep wants to start a new fish farming business, so she is applying for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy small fish and fish feed.

loans.use: To buy small fish and fish feed for new fish-farming business

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun (in the photo), age 42, purchases, raises, and sells cows. His wife, Samet, age 47, sells Cambodian sweets at home. They have been married since 1990 and they have three sons and one daughter. All of their children are in school. 

Saroeun wants to expand his business by buying additional cows to raise. Hence, he is asking for a loan of $500 to have enough capital.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale later on.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina de 28 años convive con Velarde, con quien tiene 6 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre los 13 y 1 año. Ella y su familia viven en una casa humilde pero propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Dina es una mujer que sabe organizarse. A su edad ya administra 5 lotes de terrenos que producen: café (2 lotes y medio), plátanos (2 lotes) y cacao (medio lote). De esa manera Dina distribuye sus terrenos, de tal manera que le proporcione productos para todo el año.
“Toda la cosecha la vendo en Río Negro (ciudad)”, comenta, añadiendo que en su distrito ya conoce a los compradores más fieles y pagadores. 
Ella espera cosechar 40 sacos para este año. Una buena cosecha. Pero detrás de eso, está la ardua labor, el sacrificio y la inversión constante. 
Dina requiere de personal extra para mantener sus cultivos. Por eso contrata peones, a quienes paga al día. Está contenta con su trabajo, porque todo lo que obtiene es por su esfuerzo.
Sus hijos aún son pequeños y es por ellos, por quienes lucha cada día. En sus planes está arreglar su casa con mayores comodidades y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso agradece de antemano su apoyo. Se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Inkani” es el nombre de su banco comunal, está emocionada de trabajar con personas responsables. Con el dinero podrá comprar víveres y mercadería al por mayor, para preparar los alimentos de los jornaleros, a quienes también pagará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Dina, 28, lives with Velarde and they have six children whose ages range from 13 years to 1 year.  She and her family live in a humble, but theirs, house located in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, Río Negro District, Satipo Province.  

Dina is a woman who knows how to organize herself.  At her age, she administers five parcels in production:  coffee (2-1/2 lots), bananas (2 lots) and cocoa beans (1/2 lot).  This is how Dina distributes her land so that it will produce products all year.  “I sell the entire harvest in Río Negro (city),” she comments, adding that she already knows the most reliable and best paying buyers in her zone.  She expects to harvest 40 sacks this year, a good harvest, but one due to her hard work, sacrifice and constant investment.

Dina needs extra staff to maintain her crops so she hires laborers that she pays a daily wage.  She is happy with her work because everything she gets is through her efforts.  Her children are still little so she strives for them every day.  She plans to fix up her house adding more comforts to it and to provide her children with a good education.

This would be her first loan with MFP so she thanks you in advance for your support.  She commits to be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  The name of her communal bank is “Inkani” and she’s excited about working with responsible people.  She will use the money to buy foodstuffs and merchandise at wholesale to prepare the day laborers’ meals that she will also pay to clear weeds from her crops.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to prepare food for them.

loans.name: Daro

texts.en:
Daro, age 33, is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. His wife, Sam Phors, age 31, is a cleaner. They have been married since 2001 and they just have one young son. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Daro is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a new Tuk Tuk because the old Tuk Tuk often breaks down.  

Photo: Daro is standing next to the Tuk Tuk which he wants to buy and he bought it, but he did not pay the money yet. So, he is asking for the loan to pay for purchasing the motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To purchase a new Tuk Tuk (motorcycle for transport).

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom (in the photo) is 32 years old and her husband, Pakdewat, is 41 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have three children--two sons who are in school and one daughter who is still young. 

Sokhom and her husband are fishermen. She sells fish in her local market that she and her husband catch. 

Sokhom’s house is on wooden stilts, but the wooden stilts are old and not strong. She decided to apply for a loan of $700 in order to change from wooden stilts to cement or concrete stilts. The cement of concrete stilts should be stronger than wooden stilts.

loans.use: To change from wooden stilts to cement or concrete stilts.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is a young 27-year-old mother of four dependent sons who are still in school. For the sake of her entire family, she has been working at various businesses for five years including rice farming, pigs, cow-raising, and mushroom-growing. 

Nary joined VisionFund in 2011 and she managed to pay back the loan successfully. The loan has helped her to run her multiple businesses smoothly, send her children to school, and has enabled her to have some savings. Now she can earn about US$5 per day. Therefore, she is confidently requesting a new loan of KHR 3,500,000 not only to buy a water pump and dig a well for her farmland but also buy necessary materials such as fungus, plastic bags, hay.. etc for producing mushrooms. She hopes to earn more money, keep improving her living conditions, and especially keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and dig a well for her farmland and buy necessary materials for producing mushrooms.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana (in the photo) is 48 years old and her husband, Samy, is 49 years old. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1988 and have six sons and one daughter.  

Ratana sells mangoes. She buys mangoes under contract from villagers from the blooming season till the harvesting season comes. She needs to use pesticides to keep mangoes from insects. Hence, Ratana is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide to keep mangoes from insects.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y muy colaboradora. Está casada con Mauro con quien tiene un negocio familiar  y es padre de sus 3 hijos Mauro de 25, Andi de 22  e Iby de 12 años de edad.  Vive juntos cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Martha es el transporte de pasajeros, contando para eso con una camioneta  que compró inicialmente para el transporte de carga como ganados de los fundos vecinos con una capacidad para 2 toneladas el cual compró con su propio capital. Pero  por la demanda de pasajeros decidió empezar a transportar personas , haciendo su ruta por las carreteras de la región, uniendo varios pueblos y caseríos, contando con el apoyo de su pareja para el manejo del vehiculo, el cual viene realizando desde hace más de 4 años años.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y la pocas personas que brindan éste servicio. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite viajar y conocer diversos lugares y zonas de la amazonía peruana, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para solventar los gastos de su familia, ahora viendo la rentabilidad de su negocio ya cuenta con demanda, por ello desea seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio. En un futuro quiere ampliar la cantidad de su ganadería. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentir cómodo con su banco comunal ya considera que es un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, desea invertir en la compra de 4 llantas vehiculares para su camioneta a un costo promedio de 500 nuevos soles cada uno, el capital faltante lo pondrá de su propio capital, de esa manera seguirá trabajando con normalidad y teniendo más ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha, age 46, is a very diligent and hard-working woman.  In addition to being kind, she is very helpful.  She is married to Mauro, and she has a family business with him.  They have three children.  Mauro is 25, Andi is 22, and Iby is 12.  They live together comfortably settled in their own home.

Martha’s business activity is passenger transportation.  She uses a van that she initially bought to transport loads like livestock from the neighboring farms.  It has a two ton capacity, and she bought it with her own capital.  However, because of passenger demand she decided to start transporting people.

She carries out her route on the roads of the region uniting towns and settlements.  She counts on her husband’s help with the vehicle.  She has been doing this for four years.  She believes that her business is very profitable.  She likes the business because it allows her to travel and get to know diverse places and zones in the Peruvian Amazon.  Also, the income that the business generates is to pay for the family’s expenses.  

Now that she sees the profitability of the business and has the demand, she wishes to continue growing, and she wishes to expand her business.   In the future she wants to get more livestock.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to be able to firm up her plans.  In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she thinks that this is a united and supportive group.

She wants to use the requested 1,500 soles to buy four tires for her van.  Each one costs an average of 500 soles.  She will add her own money to the loan to make up the entire amount she needs for the tires.  This way she will continue working as usual and having more income.

loans.use: to buy four tires.

loans.name: Lunes

texts.en:
Lunes is a responsible father who aims to uplift his family's standard of living to give them a better life. He is 35 years old and has four school-age children. He raised his family in a village, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. He wants to expand his vegetable plantation to increase his production and income to satisfy his family's needs and educate his children.

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production. He believes that through this loan he will be able to work out his plan and hopes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio de 42 años convive con María Elena, con quien tiene 5 hijos de 18, 16, 13, 10 y 7 años. Esta numerosa pero unida familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro – Satipo. Hace 20 años, Virgilio inició con las actividades agrícolas. La producción de cacao era su especialidad. Las exigencias de su familia le impulsaron a adquirir otros terrenos de cultivos donde ahora cultiva café.
Aún tiene que pasar 2 años para que el café produzca sus primeros granos. Virgilio está emocionado.
“La venta de cacao es rentable, cada año cosecho 5 sacos de 70 kilos cada uno”, dice. Las mejores ventas las consuma en la ciudad de Satipo, por eso mayormente reside en ese lugar, captando clientes.
Virgilio es un hombre inteligente. Con todos sus conocimientos en el campo logra mantener y educar a sus 5 hijos. Aún le falta muchos objetivos por cumplir, como ver  a sus hijos como personas independientes, para ello no descansará hasta verlos realizar. Ahora piensa abrir un pequeño negocio de comestibles, para que sus hijos lo atiendan mientras están de vacaciones. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además menciona sentirse contento por formar parte del nuevo banco comunal “Inkani”. Con el dinero podrá abrir un pequeño negocio de comestibles en su casa, para ello comprará abarrotes, gaseosas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 42, lives with María Elena with whom he has five children who are 18, 16, 13, 10 and 7 years old.  This numerous but united family lives in a house of their own in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, Río Negro District-Satipo.  

Virgilio started farming 20 years ago; his specialty is cocoa bean production.  His family needs pushed him to acquire more land where he now grows coffee.  Two years still have to pass before his coffee produces its first beans; Virgilio is excited.  “Cocoa bean sales are profitable.  Each year I harvest 5 sacks of 70 kilos each,” he says.  His best sales take place in the city of Satipo which is why he mostly lives there capturing customers.

Virgilio is an intelligent man.  With all of his knowledge about the fields he manages to support and educate his five children.  He still has many goals to reach, like seeing his children become independent people, and he will not rest until they do so.  He now plans to open a small grocery store that his children can run when they are on vacation.

This would be his first loan with MFP so he commits to being punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He also mentions that he feels happy to be part of the new “Inkani” communal bank.  With the money he will be able to open a small grocery store at home.  To do so he will buy groceries, soft-drinks and snacks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) and her husband, Hay, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker and the others attend school. 

Touch and her husband are wedding caterers. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to help with their business. Her husband will use the loan to buy food on credit, and then after the wedding he will reimburse the food vendors.

loans.use: To buy food for wedding catering.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en:
Dom (in the photo) is 32 years old and his wife, Mom, is 26 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and they just have one young son. 

Dom and his wife are garment workers. Currently, the house he built stands on his aunt’s property. He wants to move his house to his own land. Hence, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $300 to pay for moving expenses.

loans.use: To move his house to his own property.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and one child in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province. Nao has been engaged in farming for 13 years already. Through this period of time, Nao has gained good experience and earned suitable income to sustain the family.
